Chapter 1

[They]219-they were all at [Charing Cross]1-charing cross to see [Lilia]100-lilia off - [Philip]172-philip , [Harriet]102-harriet , [Irma]103-irma , [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton [herself]104-mrs. herriton . Even [Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald , squired by [Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft , had braved the journey from [Yorkshire]2-yorkshire to bid [[her]105-mrs. theobald only daughter]220-her only daughter good - bye . [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott was likewise attended by [numerous relatives]221-numerous relatives , and the sight of [so many people talking at once and saying such different things]222-so many people talking at once and saying such different things caused [Lilia]100-lilia to break into ungovernable peals of laughter .

" Quite an ovation , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia cried , sprawling out of [[her]100-lilia first - class carriage]223-her first - class carriage . " [They]1730-they 'll take [us]1731-us for royalty . Oh , [Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft , get [us]1731-us foot - warmers . "[100-lilia]

[The good - natured young man]224-the good - natured young man hurried away , and [Philip]172-philip , taking [his]172-philip place , flooded [her]100-lilia with a final stream of advice and injunctions - where to stop , how to learn Italian , when to use mosquito - nets , what pictures to look at . " Remember , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip concluded , " that it is only by going off the track that [you]100-lilia get to know [the country]1732-the country . See [the little towns]1733-the little towns - [Gubbio]3-gubbio , [Pienza]4-pienza , [Cortona]5-cortona , [San Gemignano]6-san gemignano , [Monteriano]7-monteriano . And do n't , let [me]172-philip beg [you]100-lilia , go with that awful tourist idea that [Italy]8-italy 's only [a museum of antiquities and art]1734-a museum of antiquities and art . Love and understand [the Italians]108-the italians , for [the people]1735-the people are more marvellous than [the land]1736-the land . "[172-philip]

" How [I]100-lilia wish [you]225-her brother - in - law were coming , [Philip]172-philip , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia said , flattered at the unwonted notice [[her]100-lilia brother - in - law]225-her brother - in - law was giving [her]100-lilia .

" [I]100-lilia wish [I]100-lilia were . "[100-lilia] [He]225-her brother - in - law could have managed it without great difficulty , for [his]225-her brother - in - law career at [the Bar]226-the bar was not so intense as to prevent occasional holidays . But [[his]225-her brother - in - law family]227-his family disliked [his]225-her brother - in - law continual visits to [the Continent]9-the continent , and [he]225-her brother - in - law [himself]225-her brother - in - law often found pleasure in the idea that [he]225-her brother - in - law was too busy to leave [town]228-town .

" Good - bye , [dear every one]1737-dear every one . What a whirl ! "[100-lilia] [She]100-lilia caught sight of [[her]100-lilia little daughter]229-her little daughter [Irma]103-irma , and felt that a touch of maternal solemnity was required . " Good - bye , [darling]1738-darling . Mind [you]1738-darling 're always good , and do what [Granny]109-granny tells [you]1738-darling . "[100-lilia]

[She]100-lilia referred not to [[her]100-lilia own mother]230-her own mother , but to [[her]100-lilia mother - in - law]231-her mother - in - law , [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , who hated the title of [Granny]109-granny .

[Irma]103-irma lifted a serious face to be kissed , and said cautiously , " [I]103-irma 'll do [my]103-irma best . "[103-irma]

" [She]109-granny is sure to be good , "[104-mrs. herriton] said [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , who was standing pensively a little out of the hubbub . But [Lilia]100-lilia was already calling to [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , [a tall , grave , rather nice - looking young lady who was conducting [her]107-miss abbott adieus in a more decorous manner on [the platform]233-the platform]232-a tall , grave , rather nice - looking young lady who was conducting her adieus in a more decorous manner on the platform .

" [Caroline]107-miss abbott , [[my]100-lilia [Caroline]107-miss abbott]1739-my caroline ! Jump in , or [[your]107-miss abbott chaperon]1740-your chaperon will go off without [you]107-miss abbott . "[100-lilia]

[And [Philip]172-philip , whom the idea of [Italy]8-italy always intoxicated]234-and philip , whom the idea of italy always intoxicated , had started again , telling [her]100-lilia of the supreme moments of [her]100-lilia coming journey - [the Campanile of [Airolo]10-airolo]235-the campanile of airolo , which would burst on [her]100-lilia when [she]100-lilia emerged from [the St. Gothard tunnel]236-the st. gothard tunnel , presaging the future ; the view of [the Ticino]11-the ticino and [Lago Maggiore]12-lago maggiore as [the train]237-the train climbed [the slopes of [Monte Cenere]13-monte cenere]238-the slopes of monte cenere ; the view of [Lugano]14-lugano , the view of [Como]15-como - [Italy]8-italy gathering thick around [her]100-lilia now - the arrival at [her]100-lilia first resting - place , when , after long driving through [dark and dirty streets]239-dark and dirty streets , [she]100-lilia should at last behold , amid the roar of [trams]240-trams and the glare of arc lamps , the buttresses of [the cathedral of [Milan]16-milan]241-the cathedral of milan .

" Handkerchiefs and collars , "[102-harriet] screamed [Harriet]102-harriet , " in [my]102-harriet inlaid box ! [I]102-harriet 've lent [you]243-they [my]102-harriet inlaid box . "[102-harriet]

" [Good old Harry]110-good old harry ! "[100-lilia] [She]100-lilia kissed [every one]242-every one again , and there was a moment 's silence . [They]243-they all smiled steadily , excepting [Philip]172-philip , who was choking in the fog , and [old Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald , who had begun to cry . [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott got into [the carriage]244-the carriage . [The guard]245-the guard [himself]245-the guard shut the door , and told [Lilia]100-lilia that [she]100-lilia would be all right . Then [the train]237-the train moved , and [they]243-they all moved with [it]237-the train a couple of steps , and waved [their]243-they handkerchiefs , and uttered cheerful little cries . At that moment [Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft reappeared , carrying a footwarmer by both ends , as if it was a tea - tray . [He]106-mr. kingcroft was sorry that [he]106-mr. kingcroft was too late , and called out in a quivering voice , " Good - bye , [Mrs. Charles]111-charles . May [you]111-charles enjoy [yourself]111-charles , and may [God]112-god bless [you]111-charles . "[106-mr. kingcroft]

[Lilia]100-lilia smiled and nodded , and then the absurd position of the foot - warmer overcame [her]100-lilia , and [she]100-lilia began to laugh again .

" Oh , [I]100-lilia am so sorry , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia cried back , " but [you]106-mr. kingcroft do look so funny . Oh , [you]106-mr. kingcroft all look so funny waving ! Oh , pray ! "[100-lilia] And laughing helplessly , [she]100-lilia was carried out into the fog .

" High spirits to begin so long a journey , "[105-mrs. theobald] said [Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald , dabbing [her]105-mrs. theobald eyes .

[Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft solemnly moved [his]106-mr. kingcroft head in token of agreement . " [I]106-mr. kingcroft wish , "[106-mr. kingcroft] said [he]106-mr. kingcroft , " that [Mrs. Charles]111-charles had gotten the footwarmer . [These London porters]1741-these london porters wo n't take heed to [a country chap]1742-a country chap . "[106-mr. kingcroft]

" But [you]106-mr. kingcroft did [your]106-mr. kingcroft best , "[104-mrs. herriton] said [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton . " And [I]104-mrs. herriton think it simply noble of [you]106-mr. kingcroft to have brought [Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald all the way here on such a day as this . "[104-mrs. herriton] Then , rather hastily , [she]104-mrs. herriton shook hands , and left [him]106-mr. kingcroft to take [Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald all the way back .

[Sawston]23-sawston , [[her]104-mrs. herriton own home]247-her own home , was within easy reach of [London]17-london , and [they]248-they were not late for tea . Tea was in [the dining - room]249-the dining - room , with an egg for [Irma]103-irma , to keep up [the child]250-the child 's spirits . [The house]251-the house seemed strangely quiet after a fortnight 's bustle , and [their]248-they conversation was spasmodic and subdued . [They]248-they wondered whether [the travellers]252-the travellers had got to [Folkestone]18-folkestone , whether it would be at all rough , and if so what would happen to [poor Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott .

" And , [Granny]109-granny , when will [the old ship]1743-the old ship get to [Italy]8-italy ? "[103-irma] asked [Irma]103-irma .

And [mother]1749-mother wo n't go all the way by [sea]1750-sea . [You]1744-dear look at the map of [Europe]19-europe , and [you]1744-dear 'll see why . [Harriet]102-harriet , take [her]102-harriet . " Here beginneth the New Life , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip .

" [Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft made [her]1752-the lady . [I]104-mrs. herriton am certain of it . [He]106-mr. kingcroft wanted to see [Lilia]100-lilia again , and this was the only way . "[104-mrs. herriton]

" [I]104-mrs. herriton hope [he]106-mr. kingcroft is satisfied . [I]104-mrs. herriton did not think [[my]104-mrs. herriton sister - in - law]1753-my sister - in - law distinguished [herself]1753-my sister - in - law in [her]1753-my sister - in - law farewells . "[104-mrs. herriton]

"[104-mrs. herriton]

[I]104-mrs. herriton do n't think , either , [he]106-mr. kingcroft improved [his]106-mr. kingcroft chances today . [He]106-mr. kingcroft , as well as [Lilia]100-lilia , has the knack of being absurd in public . "[104-mrs. herriton]

[Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton replied , " When [a man]1757-a man is neither well bred , nor well connected , nor handsome , nor clever , nor rich , even [Lilia]100-lilia may discard [him]106-mr. kingcroft in time . "[104-mrs. herriton]

" No . [I]104-mrs. herriton believe [she]100-lilia would take [any one]1758-any one . " [[My]104-mrs. herriton dear boy]1763-my dear boy ! If possible , [she]100-lilia has got worse and worse . It was [your]172-philip idea of Italian travel that saved [us]1764-us ! "[104-mrs. herriton]

[Philip]172-philip brightened at the little compliment . " The odd part is that [she]100-lilia was quite eager - always asking [me]172-philip for information ; and of course [I]172-philip was very glad to give it . [I]172-philip admit [she]100-lilia is [a Philistine]1765-a philistine , appallingly ignorant , and [her]100-lilia taste in art is false . Still , to have any taste at all is something . "[257-his mother , who had heard enough of the praises of italy]

" No , [Mother]115-mother ; no . [She]100-lilia was really keen on [Italy]8-italy . This travel is quite a crisis for [her]100-lilia . "[172-philip] [He]172-philip found the situation full of whimsical romance : there was something half attractive , half repellent in the thought of [this vulgar woman journeying to places [he]172-philip loved and revered]258-this vulgar woman journeying to places he loved and revered . Why should [she]259-she not be transfigured ? The same had happened to [the Goths]116-the goths .

[Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton did not believe in romance nor in transfiguration , nor in parallels from history , nor in anything else that may disturb domestic life . [She]104-mrs. herriton adroitly changed the subject before [Philip]172-philip got excited . Soon [Harriet]102-harriet returned , having given [her]102-harriet lesson in geography . [Irma]103-irma went to bed early , and was tucked up by [[her]103-irma grandmother]260-her grandmother . Then [the two ladies]261-the two ladies worked and played cards . [Philip]172-philip read a book . And so [they]261-the two ladies all settled down to [their]261-the two ladies quiet , profitable existence , and continued it without interruption through the winter .

It was now nearly ten years since [Charles]111-charles had fallen in love with [Lilia Theobald]100-lilia because [she]100-lilia was pretty , and during that time [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton had hardly known a moment 's rest . For six months [she]104-mrs. herriton schemed to prevent the match , and when it had taken place [she]104-mrs. herriton turned to another task - the supervision of [[her]104-mrs. herriton daughter - in - law]262-her daughter - in - law . [Lilia]100-lilia must be pushed through life without bringing discredit on [the family into which [she]100-lilia had married]263-the family into which she had married . [She]100-lilia was aided by [Charles]111-charles , by [[her]104-mrs. herriton daughter]264-her daughter [Harriet]102-harriet , and , as soon as [he]172-philip was old enough , by [the clever one of [the family]266-the family]265-the clever one of the family , [Philip]172-philip . The birth of [Irma]103-irma made things still more difficult . But fortunately [old Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald , who had attempted interference , began to break up . It was an effort to [her]100-lilia to leave [Whitby]22-whitby , and [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton discouraged the effort as far as possible . That curious duel which is fought over [every baby]267-every baby was fought and decided early . [Irma]103-irma belonged to [[[her]103-irma father]268-her father 's family]269-her father 's family , not to [[her]103-irma mother]270-her mother 's .

[Charles]111-charles died , and the struggle recommenced . [Lilia]100-lilia tried to assert [herself]100-lilia , and said that [she]100-lilia should go to take care of [Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald . It required all [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton 's kindness to prevent [her]100-lilia . [A house]271-a house was finally taken for [her]100-lilia at [Sawston]23-sawston , and there for three years [she]100-lilia lived with [Irma]103-irma , continually subject to the refining influences of [[her]100-lilia late husband 's family]272-her late husband 's family .

During one of [her]100-lilia rare Yorkshire visits trouble began again . [Lilia]100-lilia confided to [a friend]273-a friend that [she]100-lilia liked [a Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft extremely , but that [she]100-lilia was not exactly engaged to [him]106-mr. kingcroft . The news came round to [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , who at once wrote , begging for information , and pointing out that [Lilia]100-lilia must either be engaged or not , since no intermediate state existed . It was a good letter , and flurried [Lilia]100-lilia extremely . [She]100-lilia left [Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft without even the pressure of [a rescue - party]274-a rescue - party . [She]100-lilia cried a great deal on [her]100-lilia return to [Sawston]23-sawston , and said [she]100-lilia was very sorry . [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton took the opportunity of speaking more seriously about the duties of widowhood and motherhood than [she]104-mrs. herriton had ever done before . But somehow things never went easily after . [Lilia]100-lilia would not settle down in [[her]100-lilia place among [Sawston matrons]276-sawston matrons]275-her place among sawston matrons . [She]100-lilia was [a bad housekeeper]277-a bad housekeeper , always in the throes of some domestic crisis , which [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , who kept [[her]104-mrs. herriton servants]278-her servants for years , had to step across and adjust . [She]104-mrs. herriton let [Irma]103-irma stop away from [school]279-school for insufficient reasons , and [she]104-mrs. herriton allowed [her]103-irma to wear rings . [She]100-lilia learnt to bicycle , for the purpose of waking [the place]280-the place up , and coasted down [the High Street]281-the high street one Sunday evening , falling off at the turn by [the church]282-the church . If [she]100-lilia had not been [a relative]283-a relative , it would have been entertaining . But even [Philip]172-philip , who in theory loved outraging English conventions , rose to the occasion , and gave [her]100-lilia a talking which [she]100-lilia remembered to [her]100-lilia dying day . It was just then , too , that [they]284-they discovered that [she]100-lilia still allowed [Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft to write to [her]100-lilia " as [a gentleman friend]1770-a gentleman friend , "[284-they] and to send presents to [Irma]103-irma .

[Philip]172-philip thought of [Italy]8-italy , and the situation was saved . [Caroline]107-miss abbott , charming , sober , [Caroline Abbott]107-miss abbott , who lived [two turnings away]285-two turnings away , was seeking [a companion]286-a companion for a year 's travel . [Lilia]100-lilia gave up [[her]100-lilia house]287-her house , sold half [her]100-lilia furniture , left the other half and [Irma]103-irma with [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , and had now departed , amid universal approval , for a change of scene .

[She]100-lilia wrote to [them]284-they frequently during the winter - more frequently than [she]100-lilia wrote to [[her]100-lilia mother]270-her mother . [Her]100-lilia letters were always prosperous . [Florence]24-florence [she]100-lilia found perfectly sweet , Naples a dream , but very whiffy . In [Rome]25-rome [one]289-one had simply to sit still and feel . [Philip]172-philip , however , declared that [she]100-lilia was improving . [He]172-philip was particularly gratified when in the early spring [she]100-lilia began to visit [the smaller towns that [he]172-philip had recommended]290-the smaller towns that he had recommended . " In [a place like this]1771-a place like this , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia wrote , " [one]289-one really does feel in the heart of things , and off the beaten track . Looking out of a Gothic window every morning , it seems impossible that the middle ages have passed away . "[100-lilia] The letter was from [Monteriano]7-monteriano , and concluded with a not unsuccessful description of [the wonderful little town]291-the wonderful little town .

" It is something that [she]270-her mother is contented , "[104-mrs. herriton] said [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton . " But [no one]1773-no one could live three months with [Caroline Abbott]107-miss abbott and not be the better for it . "[104-mrs. herriton]

Just then [Irma]103-irma came in from [school]279-school , and [she]103-irma read [[her]103-irma mother]270-her mother 's letter to [her]103-irma , carefully correcting any grammatical errors , for [she]103-irma was a loyal supporter of parental authority - [Irma]103-irma listened politely , but soon changed the subject to hockey , in which [her]103-irma whole being was absorbed . [They]294-they were to vote for colours that afternoon - yellow and white or yellow and green . What did [[her]103-irma grandmother]260-her grandmother think ?

Of course [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton had an opinion , which [she]104-mrs. herriton sedately expounded , in spite of [Harriet]102-harriet , who said that colours were unnecessary for [children]296-children , and of [Philip]172-philip , who said that they were ugly . [She]104-mrs. herriton was getting proud of [Irma]103-irma , who had certainly greatly improved , and could no longer be called that most appalling of things - [a vulgar child]297-a vulgar child . [She]104-mrs. herriton was anxious to form [her]103-irma before [[her]103-irma mother]270-her mother returned . So [she]104-mrs. herriton had no objection to the leisurely movements of [the travellers]252-the travellers , and even suggested that [they]252-the travellers should overstay [their]252-the travellers year if it suited [them]252-the travellers .

[Lilia]100-lilia 's next letter was also from [Monteriano]7-monteriano , and [Philip]172-philip grew quite enthusiastic .

" [They]252-the travellers 've stopped [there]1769-there over a week ! "[172-philip] [he]172-philip cried . " Why ! [I]172-philip should n't have done as much [myself]172-philip . [They]252-the travellers must be really keen , for [the hotel]1775-the hotel 's none too comfortable . "[172-philip]

[They]312-they started together . [Irma]103-irma was gratified ; but conversation flagged , for [Philip]172-philip had not the art of talking to [the young]313-the young . Then [she]104-mrs. herriton helped [the cook]314-the cook to clear , ordered dinner , and started [the housemaid]315-the housemaid turning out [the drawing - room]316-the drawing - room , Tuesday being its day . The weather was lovely , and [she]104-mrs. herriton thought [she]104-mrs. herriton would do a little gardening , as it was quite early . [She]104-mrs. herriton called [Harriet]102-harriet , who had recovered from the insult to [St. James]119-st. james 's , and together [they]312-they went to the [kitchen garden]317-kitchen garden and began to sow some early vegetables .

" [We]312-they will save the peas to the last ; they are the greatest fun , "[104-mrs. herriton] said [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , who had the gift of making work a treat . [She]104-mrs. herriton and [[her]104-mrs. herriton elderly daughter]318-her elderly daughter always got on very well , though [they]312-they had not a great deal in common . [Harriet]102-harriet 's education had been almost too successful . As [Philip]172-philip once said , [she]102-harriet had " bolted all the cardinal virtues and could n't digest them . "[102-harriet] Though pious and patriotic , and a great moral asset for [the house]251-the house , [she]102-harriet lacked that pliancy and tact which [[her]102-harriet mother]270-her mother so much valued , and had expected [her]102-harriet to pick up for [herself]102-harriet . [Harriet]102-harriet , if [she]102-harriet had been allowed , would have driven [Lilia]100-lilia to an open rupture , and , what was worse , [she]102-harriet would have done the same to [Philip]172-philip two years before , when [he]172-philip returned full of passion for [Italy]8-italy , and ridiculing [Sawston]23-sawston and its ways .

" It 's a shame , [Mother]115-mother ! "[102-harriet] [she]102-harriet had cried . " [Philip]172-philip laughs at everything - [the Book Club]1793-the book club , [the Debating Society]1794-the debating society , the Progressive Whist , the bazaars . [They]321-we sowed the duller vegetables first , and a pleasant feeling of righteous fatigue stole over [them]321-we as [they]321-we addressed [themselves]321-we to the peas . [Harriet]102-harriet stretched a string to guide the row straight , and [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton scratched a furrow with a pointed stick . " It 's twelve ! The second post 's in . Run and see if there are any letters . "[104-mrs. herriton]

[Harriet]102-harriet did not want to go . " Let 's finish the peas . There wo n't be any letters . "[104-mrs. herriton]

[Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton was very careful to let those peas trickle evenly from [her]104-mrs. herriton hand , and at the end of the row [she]104-mrs. herriton was conscious that [she]104-mrs. herriton had never sown better . They were expensive too .

" Actually [old Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald ! "[102-harriet] said [Harriet]102-harriet , returning .

" [Your]103-irma feet grow larger every day , "[356-the agonized harriet] said [the agonized Harriet]356-the agonized harriet , and gave [[her]104-mrs. herriton niece]357-her niece a violent push . " It is too bad , "[104-mrs. herriton] said [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton . [Irma]103-irma said it was three bad , and was told not to be rude . [She]362-she spoke just too much , and [the cook]314-the cook said that if [she]362-she could not give satisfaction - [she]362-she had better leave . " No answer , "[104-mrs. herriton] said [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton . " Get down [Mr. Philip]172-philip 's Gladstone from [the attic]1831-the attic . "[104-mrs. herriton]

[She]104-mrs. herriton would not allow [herself]104-mrs. herriton to be frightened by the unknown . Indeed [she]104-mrs. herriton knew a little now . [The man]370-the man was not [an Italian noble]371-an italian noble , otherwise the telegram would have said so . It must have been written by [Lilia]100-lilia . "[100-lilia] [She]104-mrs. herriton recalled phrases of this morning 's letter : " [We]1833-we love [this place]1787-this place - [Caroline]107-miss abbott is sweeter than ever , and busy sketching - [Italians full of simplicity and charm]1835-italians full of simplicity and charm . "[104-mrs. herriton] And the remark of [Baedeker]126-baedeker , " [The inhabitants]350-the inhabitants are still noted for [their]350-the inhabitants agreeable manners , "[126-baedeker] had a baleful meaning now . If [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton had no imagination , [she]104-mrs. herriton had intuition , a more useful quality , and the picture [she]104-mrs. herriton made to [herself]104-mrs. herriton of [[Lilia]100-lilia 's FIANCE]372-lilia 's fiance did not prove altogether wrong .

So [Philip]172-philip was received with the news that [he]172-philip must start in half an hour for [Monteriano]7-monteriano . [He]172-philip was in a painful position . For three years [he]172-philip had sung the praises of [the Italians]108-the italians , but [he]172-philip had never contemplated having one as [a relative]283-a relative . [He]172-philip tried to soften the thing down to [[his]172-philip mother]307-his mother , but in [his]172-philip heart of hearts [he]172-philip agreed with [her]307-his mother when [she]307-his mother said , " [The man]370-the man may be [a duke]1838-a duke or [he]370-the man may be [an organ - grinder]1839-an organ - grinder . That is not the point . If [Lilia]100-lilia marries [him]370-the man [she]100-lilia insults the memory of [Charles]111-charles , [she]100-lilia insults [Irma]103-irma , [she]100-lilia insults [us]1840-us . Therefore [I]307-his mother forbid [her]100-lilia , and if [she]100-lilia disobeys [we]1840-us have done with [her]100-lilia for ever . "[307-his mother]

" [I]172-philip will do all [I]172-philip can , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip in a low voice . It was the first time [he]172-philip had had anything to do . [He]172-philip kissed [[his]172-philip mother]307-his mother and [sister]376-sister and puzzled [Irma]103-irma . [The hall]377-the hall was warm and attractive as [he]172-philip looked back into [it]377-the hall from the cold March night , and [he]172-philip departed for [Italy]8-italy reluctantly , as for something commonplace and dull .

Before [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton went to bed [she]104-mrs. herriton wrote to [Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald , using plain language about [Lilia]100-lilia 's conduct , and hinting that it was a question on which [every one]242-every one must definitely choose sides . [She]104-mrs. herriton added , as if it was an afterthought , that [Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald 's letter had arrived that morning .

Just as [she]104-mrs. herriton was going [upstairs]379-upstairs [she]104-mrs. herriton remembered that [she]104-mrs. herriton never covered up those peas . It upset [her]104-mrs. herriton more than anything , and again and again [she]104-mrs. herriton struck the banisters with vexation . Late as it was , [she]104-mrs. herriton got a lantern from [the tool - shed]380-the tool - shed and went down [the garden]381-the garden to rake the earth over them . The sparrows had taken every one . But countless fragments of the letter remained , disfiguring the tidy ground .

Chapter 2

When [the bewildered tourist]382-the bewildered tourist alights at [the station of [Monteriano]7-monteriano]383-the station of monteriano , [he]382-the bewildered tourist finds [himself]382-the bewildered tourist in [the middle of [the country]1732-the country]384-the middle of the country . There are [a few houses round [the railway]387-the railway]386-a few houses round the railway , and many more dotted over [the plain]388-the plain and [the slopes of [the hills]390-the hills]389-the slopes of the hills , but of [a town]391-a town , mediaeval or otherwise , not the slightest sign . [He]382-the bewildered tourist must take what is suitably termed a " legno "[382-the bewildered tourist] - a piece of wood - and drive up eight miles of [excellent road]392-excellent road into the middle ages . For it is impossible , as well as sacrilegious , to be as quick as [Baedeker]126-baedeker .

It was three in the afternoon when [Philip]172-philip left [the realms of commonsense]393-the realms of commonsense . [He]172-philip was so weary with travelling that [he]172-philip had fallen asleep in [the train]237-the train . [[His]172-philip fellow - passengers]395-his fellow - passengers had the usual Italian gift of divination , and when [Monteriano]7-monteriano came [they]395-his fellow - passengers knew [he]172-philip wanted to go [there]1769-there , and dropped [him]172-philip out . [His]172-philip feet sank into the hot asphalt of [the platform]233-the platform , and in a dream [he]172-philip watched [the train]237-the train depart , while [the porter who ought to have been carrying [his]172-philip bag]399-the porter who ought to have been carrying his bag , ran up the line playing touch - [you]400-you - last with [the guard]245-the guard . Alas ! [he]172-philip was in no humour for [Italy]8-italy . Bargaining for [a legno]402-a legno bored [him]172-philip unutterably . [The man]370-the man asked six lire ; and though [Philip]172-philip knew that for eight miles it should scarcely be more than four , yet [he]172-philip was about to give what [he]172-philip was asked , and so make [the man]370-the man discontented and unhappy for the rest of the day . [He]172-philip was saved from this social blunder by loud shouts , and looking up [the road]405-the road saw one cracking [his]370-the man whip and waving [his]370-the man reins and driving two horses furiously , and behind [him]172-philip there appeared the swaying figure of [a woman]406-a woman , holding star - fish fashion on to anything [she]406-a woman could touch . It was [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , who had just received [his]172-philip letter from [Milan]16-milan announcing the time of [his]172-philip arrival , and had hurried down to meet [him]172-philip .

[He]172-philip had known [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott for years , and had never had much opinion about [her]107-miss abbott one way or the other . [She]107-miss abbott was good , quiet , dull , and amiable , and young only because [she]107-miss abbott was twenty - three : there was nothing in [her]107-miss abbott appearance or manner to suggest the fire of youth . All [her]107-miss abbott life had been spent at [Sawston]23-sawston with [a dull and amiable father]407-a dull and amiable father , and [her]107-miss abbott pleasant , pallid face , bent on some respectable charity , was a familiar object of [the Sawston streets]408-the sawston streets . Why [she]107-miss abbott had ever wished to leave [them]408-the sawston streets was surprising ; but as [she]107-miss abbott truly said , " [I]107-miss abbott am [John Bull]130-john bull to the backbone , yet [I]107-miss abbott do want to see [Italy]8-italy , just once . [Everybody]1841-everybody says it is marvellous , and that [one]289-one gets no idea of it from books at all . "[107-miss abbott] [The curate]409-the curate suggested that a year was a long time ; and [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , with decorous playfulness , answered [him]409-the curate , " Oh , but [you]409-the curate must let [me]107-miss abbott have [my]107-miss abbott fling ! [I]107-miss abbott promise to have it once , and once only . It will give [me]107-miss abbott things to think about and talk about for the rest of [my]107-miss abbott life . "[107-miss abbott] [The curate]409-the curate had consented ; so had [Mr. Abbott]128-mr. abbott . And here [she]107-miss abbott was in a legno , solitary , dusty , frightened , with as much to answer and to answer for as [the most dashing adventuress]411-the most dashing adventuress could desire .

[They]412-they shook hands without speaking . [She]107-miss abbott made room for [Philip]172-philip and [his]172-philip luggage amidst the loud indignation of [the unsuccessful driver]413-the unsuccessful driver , whom it required the combined eloquence of [the station - master]414-the station - master and [the station beggar]415-the station beggar to confute . The silence was prolonged until [they]412-they started . For three days [he]172-philip had been considering what [he]172-philip should do , and still more what [he]172-philip should say . [He]172-philip had invented a dozen imaginary conversations , in all of which [his]172-philip logic and eloquence procured [him]172-philip certain victory . But how to begin ? [He]172-philip was in [[the enemy]416-the enemy 's country]417-the enemy 's country , and everything - the hot sun , the cold air behind the heat , the endless rows of olive - trees , regular yet mysterious - seemed hostile to the placid atmosphere of [Sawston]23-sawston in which [his]172-philip thoughts took birth . At the outset [he]172-philip made one great concession . If the match was really suitable , and [Lilia]100-lilia were bent on it , [he]172-philip would give in , and trust to [his]172-philip influence with [[his]172-philip mother]307-his mother to set things right . [He]172-philip would not have made the concession in [England]20-england ; but here in [Italy]8-italy , [Lilia]100-lilia , however wilful and silly , was at all events growing to be [a human being]419-a human being .

" Are [we]1843-we to talk it over now ? "[172-philip] [he]172-philip asked .

[Her]107-miss abbott face was that of [a perfect fool]420-a perfect fool - [a fool in terror]421-a fool in terror .

" A short time - quite a short time , "[107-miss abbott] [she]107-miss abbott stammered , as if the shortness of the time would reassure [him]172-philip .

" [I]172-philip should like to know how long , if [you]172-philip can remember . "[172-philip]

At that moment [the carriage]244-the carriage entered a little wood , which lay brown and sombre across [the cultivated hill]432-the cultivated hill . The trees of [the wood]433-the wood were small and leafless , but noticeable for this - that their stems stood in violets as rocks stand in [the summer sea]434-the summer sea . There are such violets in [England]20-england , but not so many . Nor are there so many in Art , for [no painter]435-no painter has the courage . [The cart - ruts]436-the cart - ruts were [channels]437-channels , [the hollow lagoons]438-the hollow lagoons ; even the dry white margin of [the road]405-the road was splashed , like a causeway soon to be submerged under the advancing tide of spring . " [The men in [it]1853-the crack regiment]1854-the men in it must be short and broad . [They]1854-the men in it must also be able to walk six miles an hour . "[107-miss abbott]

[She]107-miss abbott looked at [him]172-philip wildly , not understanding all that [he]172-philip said , but feeling that [he]172-philip was very clever . Then [she]107-miss abbott continued [her]107-miss abbott defence of [Signor Carella]131-signor carella .

" [Mr. Herriton]136-mr. herriton , do n't - please , [Mr. Herriton]136-mr. herriton - [a dentist]1869-a dentist . [[His]172-philip father]1863-his father 's [a dentist]1869-a dentist . "[107-miss abbott]

[He]172-philip thought of [Lilia]100-lilia no longer . [He]172-philip was anxious for [himself]172-philip : [he]172-philip feared that Romance might die .

Romance only dies with life . [No pair of pincers]450-no pair of pincers will ever pull it out of [us]451-us . But there is a spurious sentiment which can not resist the unexpected and the incongruous and the grotesque . A touch will loosen it , and the sooner it goes from [us]451-us the better . It was going from [Philip]172-philip now , and therefore [he]172-philip gave the cry of pain .

" [I]172-philip can not think what is in the air , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip began . [A boy of medium height with a pretty face]1872-a boy of medium height with a pretty face , [the son of [a dentist at [Monteriano]7-monteriano]443-a dentist at monteriano]1873-the son of a dentist at monteriano . " Stop ! [I]453-he 'll tell [you]453-he no more . "[453-he]

" Really , [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , it is a little late for reticence . [You]107-miss abbott have equipped [me]172-philip admirably ! "[172-philip]

" [I]452-her 'll tell [you]453-he not another word ! "[452-her] [she]452-her cried , with a spasm of terror . Then [she]452-her got out [her]452-her handkerchief , and seemed as if [she]452-her would shed tears . After a silence , which [he]453-he intended to symbolize to [her]452-her the dropping of a curtain on the scene , [he]453-he began to talk of other subjects .

[They]454-they were among olives again , and the wood with its beauty and wildness had passed away . But as [they]454-they climbed higher [the country]1732-the country opened out , and there appeared , high on [a hill to the right]456-a hill to the right , [Monteriano]7-monteriano . The hazy green of the olives rose up to [its]7-monteriano walls , and it seemed to float in isolation between trees and sky , like [some fantastic ship city of a dream]457-some fantastic ship city of a dream . [Its]7-monteriano colour was brown , and it revealed not [a single house]458-a single house - nothing but the narrow circle of the walls , and behind them [seventeen towers]459-seventeen towers - all that was left of the fifty - two that had filled [the city]460-the city in [her]452-her prime . Some were only stumps , some were inclining stiffly to their fall , some were still erect , piercing like masts into the blue . It was impossible to praise [it]7-monteriano as beautiful , but it was also impossible to damn [it]7-monteriano as quaint .

Meanwhile [Philip]172-philip talked continually , thinking this to be great evidence of resource and tact . It showed [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott that [he]453-he had probed [her]452-her to the bottom , but was able to conquer [his]453-he disgust , and by sheer force of intellect continue to be as agreeable and amusing as ever . [He]453-he did not know that [he]453-he talked a good deal of nonsense , and that the sheer force of [his]453-he intellect was weakened by the sight of [Monteriano]7-monteriano , and by the thought of dentistry within those walls .

[The town]461-the town above [them]462-them swung to the left , to the right , to the left again , as [the road]405-the road wound upward through the trees , and [the towers]464-the towers began to glow in the descending sun . As [they]462-them drew near , [Philip]172-philip saw the heads of [people gathering black upon the walls]465-people gathering black upon the walls , and [he]172-philip knew well what was happening - how the news was spreading that [a stranger]466-a stranger was in sight , and [the beggars]467-the beggars were aroused from [their]467-the beggars content and bid to adjust [their]467-the beggars deformities ; how [the alabaster man]468-the alabaster man was running for [his]468-the alabaster man wares , and [the Authorized Guide]469-the authorized guide running for [his]468-the alabaster man peaked cap and [his]468-the alabaster man two cards of recommendation - one from [Miss M'Gee]139-miss m'gee , [Maida Vale]52-maida vale , [the other]470-the other , less valuable , from [an Equerry]471-an equerry to [the Queen of [Peru]53-peru]472-the queen of peru ; how [some one else]473-some one else was running to tell [the landlady of the Stella]474-the landlady of the stella d'Italia to put on [her]474-the landlady of the stella pearl necklace and brown boots and empty the slops from [the spare bedroom]475-the spare bedroom ; and how [the landlady]476-the landlady was running to tell [Lilia]100-lilia and [[her]476-the landlady boy]477-her boy that [their]478-they fate was at hand .

Perhaps it was a pity [Philip]172-philip had talked so profusely . [He]172-philip had driven [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott half demented , but [he]172-philip had given [himself]172-philip no time to concert a plan . The end came so suddenly . [They]478-they emerged from the trees on to [the terrace before the walk]479-the terrace before the walk , with the vision of half Tuscany radiant in the sun behind [them]478-they , and then [they]478-they turned in through the [Siena]31-siena gate , and [their]478-they journey was over . [The Dogana men]480-the dogana men admitted [them]478-they with an air of gracious welcome , and [they]478-they clattered up [the narrow dark street]481-the narrow dark street , greeted by that mixture of curiosity and kindness which makes [each Italian arrival]482-each italian arrival so wonderful .

[He]172-philip was stunned and knew not what to do . At [the hotel]1775-the hotel [he]172-philip received no ordinary reception . [The landlady]476-the landlady wrung [him]172-philip by the hand ; [one person]485-one person snatched [his]172-philip umbrella , another [his]172-philip bag ; [people]1776-people pushed [each other]487-each other out of [his]172-philip way . The entrance seemed blocked with [a crowd]488-a crowd . [Dogs]489-dogs were barking , bladder whistles being blown , [women]490-women waving [their]490-women handkerchiefs , [excited children]491-excited children screaming on the stairs , and at the top of the stairs was [Lilia]100-lilia [herself]100-lilia , very radiant , with [her]100-lilia best blouse on .

" Welcome ! "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia cried . " Welcome to [Monteriano]7-monteriano ! "[172-philip] [He]172-philip greeted [her]100-lilia , for [he]172-philip did not know what else to do , and a sympathetic murmur rose from [the crowd below]492-the crowd below .

" [You]172-philip told [me]100-lilia to come here , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia continued , " and [I]100-lilia do n't forget it . Let [me]100-lilia introduce [Signor Carella]131-signor carella ! "[100-lilia]

[Philip]172-philip discerned in the corner behind [her]100-lilia a young man who might eventually prove handsome and well - made , but certainly did not seem so then . [He]172-philip was half enveloped in the drapery of a cold dirty curtain , and nervously stuck out a hand , which [Philip]172-philip took and found thick and damp . There were more murmurs of approval from the stairs .

" Well , din - din 's nearly ready , "[100-lilia] said [Lilia]100-lilia . " [[Your]172-philip room]1875-your room 's down [the passage]1876-the passage , [Philip]172-philip . [You]172-philip need n't go changing . "[100-lilia]

[He]172-philip stumbled away to wash [his]172-philip hands , utterly crushed by [her]100-lilia effrontery .

" [Dear Caroline]140-dear caroline ! "[100-lilia] whispered [Lilia]100-lilia as soon as [he]172-philip had gone . " What [an angel]1868-an angel [you]172-philip 've been to tell [him]172-philip ! [He]172-philip takes it so well . But [you]172-philip must have had a MAUVAIS QUART D'HEURE . "[100-lilia]

[Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott 's long terror suddenly turned into acidity . " [I]100-lilia 've told nothing , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia snapped . " It 's all for [you]172-philip - and if it only takes a quarter of an hour [you]172-philip 'll be lucky ! "[100-lilia]

Dinner was a nightmare . [They]493-they had [the smelly dining - room]494-the smelly dining - room to [themselves]493-they . [Lilia]100-lilia , very smart and vociferous , was at the head of the table ; [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , also in [her]107-miss abbott best , sat by [Philip]172-philip , looking , to [his]172-philip irritated nerves , more like [the tragedy confidante]495-the tragedy confidante every moment . [That scion of the Italian nobility]496-that scion of the italian nobility , [Signor Carella]131-signor carella , sat opposite . Behind [him]131-signor carella loomed a bowl of goldfish , who swam round and round , gaping at [the guests]497-the guests .

The face of [Signor Carella]131-signor carella was twitching too much for [Philip]172-philip to study it . But [he]172-philip could see the hands , which were not particularly clean , and did not get cleaner by fidgeting amongst the shining slabs of hair . [His]172-philip starched cuffs were not clean either , and as for [his]172-philip suit , it had obviously been bought for the occasion as something really English - a gigantic check , which did not even fit . [His]172-philip handkerchief [he]172-philip had forgotten , but never missed it . Altogether , [he]172-philip was quite unpresentable , and very lucky to have [a father who was [a dentist in [Monteriano]7-monteriano]499-a dentist in monteriano]498-a father who was a dentist in monteriano . And why , even [Lilia]100-lilia - But as soon as the meal began it furnished [Philip]172-philip with an explanation .

For [the youth]500-the youth was hungry , and [[his]172-philip lady]501-his lady filled [his]172-philip plate with spaghetti , and when those delicious slippery worms were flying down [his]172-philip throat , [his]172-philip face relaxed and became for a moment unconscious and calm . And [Philip]172-philip had seen that face before in [Italy]8-italy a hundred times - seen it and loved it , for it was not merely beautiful , but had the charm which is the rightful heritage of all who are born on [that soil]502-that soil . But [he]172-philip did not want to see it opposite [him]172-philip at dinner . It was not the face of [a gentleman]326-a gentleman .

Conversation , to give [it]504-it that name , was carried on in a mixture of English and Italian . [Lilia]100-lilia had picked up hardly any of the latter language , and [Signor Carella]131-signor carella had not yet learnt any of the former . [Occasionally Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott had to act as interpreter between [the lovers]505-the lovers , and the situation became uncouth and revolting in the extreme . Yet [Philip]172-philip was too cowardly to break forth and denounce the engagement . [He]172-philip thought [he]172-philip should be more effective with [Lilia]100-lilia if [he]172-philip had [her]100-lilia alone , and pretended to [himself]172-philip that [he]172-philip must hear [her]100-lilia defence before giving judgment .

[Signor Carella]131-signor carella , heartened by the spaghetti and the throat - rasping wine , attempted to talk , and , looking politely towards [Philip]172-philip , said , " [England]20-england is [a great country]1878-a great country . [The Italians]108-the italians love [England]20-england and the English . "[131-signor carella]

[Philip]172-philip , in no mood for international amenities , merely bowed .

" [Italy]8-italy too , "[470-the other] [the other]470-the other continued a little resentfully , " is [a great country]1878-a great country . [She]8-italy has produced [many famous men]1880-many famous men - for example [Garibaldi]141-caffe garibaldi and [Dante]127-dante purg . xx . [The latter]1881-the latter wrote the ' Inferno , ' the ' Purgatorio , ' the ' Paradiso . ' The ' Inferno ' is the most beautiful . "[470-the other] And with the complacent tone of [one who has received a solid education]507-one who has received a solid education , [he]172-philip quoted the opening lines -

Nel mezzo del cammin di nostra vita Mi ritrovai per una selva oscura Che la diritta via era smarrita -

a quotation which was more apt than [he]172-philip supposed .

[Lilia]100-lilia glanced at [Philip]172-philip to see whether [he]172-philip noticed that [she]100-lilia was marrying [no ignoramus]508-no ignoramus . Anxious to exhibit all the good qualities of [[her]100-lilia betrothed]509-her betrothed , [she]100-lilia abruptly introduced the subject of pallone , in which , it appeared , [he]172-philip was [a proficient player]510-a proficient player . [He]172-philip suddenly became shy and developed a conceited grin - the grin of [the village yokel whose cricket score is mentioned before [a stranger]466-a stranger]511-the village yokel whose cricket score is mentioned before a stranger . [Philip]172-philip [himself]172-philip had loved to watch pallone , that entrancing combination of lawn - tennis and fives . But [he]172-philip did not expect to love it quite so much again .

" Oh , look ! "[100-lilia] exclaimed [Lilia]100-lilia , " the poor wee fish ! "[100-lilia]

A starved cat had been worrying [them]513-them all for pieces of the purple quivering beef [they]513-them were trying to swallow . [Signor Carella]131-signor carella , with the brutality so common in [Italians]108-the italians , had caught [her]100-lilia by the paw and flung [her]100-lilia away from [him]131-signor carella . Now [she]100-lilia had climbed up to the bowl and was trying to hook out the fish . [He]131-signor carella got up , drove [her]100-lilia off , and finding a large glass stopper by the bowl , entirely plugged up the aperture with it .

" But may not the fish die ? "[107-miss abbott] said [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott . " [They]1882-they have no air . "[107-miss abbott]

" [Fish]142-fish live on water , not on air , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip replied in a knowing voice , and sat down . Apparently [he]172-philip was at [his]172-philip ease again , for [he]172-philip took to spitting on the floor . [She]100-lilia talked bravely till the end of the disgusting meal , and then got up saying , " Well , [Philip]172-philip , [I]100-lilia am sure [you]172-philip are ready for by - bye . It was a little too impudent . "[172-philip] [He]172-philip heard [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott gasp . [Signor Carella]131-signor carella , who was lighting a rank cigar , had not understood .

It was as [he]172-philip expected . When [he]172-philip was alone with [Lilia]100-lilia [he]172-philip lost all nervousness . The remembrance of [his]172-philip long intellectual supremacy strengthened [him]172-philip , and [he]172-philip began volubly -

What follows should be prefaced with some simile - the simile of a powder - mine , a thunderbolt , an earthquake - for it blew [Philip]172-philip up in the air and flattened [him]172-philip on the ground and swallowed [him]172-philip up in the depths . " Do , "[522-she] [she]522-she cried . " Tell [him]521-him so now . Have it out with [him]521-him . [Gino]144-gino ! [Gino]144-gino ! Come in ! Avanti ! [Fra Filippo]145-fra filippo forbids [the banns]1940-the banns ! "[522-she]

" [Fra Filippo]145-fra filippo 's blood 's up . [He]521-him shrinks from nothing . Oh , take care [he]521-him does n't hurt [you]172-philip ! "[522-she] [She]522-she swayed about in vulgar imitation of [Philip]172-philip 's walk , and then , with a proud glance at [the square shoulders of [[her]522-she betrothed]509-her betrothed]523-the square shoulders of her betrothed , flounced out of [the room]306-the room .

Did [she]522-she intend [them]526-them to fight ? [Philip]172-philip had no intention of doing so ; and no more , it seemed , had [Gino]144-gino , who stood nervously in the middle of [the room]306-the room with twitching lips and eyes .

" Please sit down , [Signor Carella]131-signor carella , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip in Italian . " [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton is rather agitated , but there is no reason [we]526-them should not be calm . Might [I]172-philip offer [you]172-philip a cigarette ? Please sit down . "[172-philip]

[He]172-philip refused the cigarette and the chair , and remained standing in the full glare of the lamp . [Philip]172-philip , not averse to such assistance , got [his]172-philip own face into shadow .

For a long time [he]172-philip was silent . It might impress [Gino]144-gino , and it also gave [him]172-philip time to collect [himself]172-philip . [He]172-philip would not this time fall into the error of blustering , which [he]172-philip had caught so unaccountably from [Lilia]100-lilia . [He]172-philip would make [his]172-philip power felt by restraint .

Why , when [he]172-philip looked up to begin , was [Gino]144-gino convulsed with silent laughter ? It vanished immediately ; but [he]172-philip became nervous , and was even more pompous than [he]172-philip intended .

" [Signor Carella]131-signor carella , [I]172-philip will be frank with [you]172-philip . [I]172-philip have come to prevent [you]172-philip marrying [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , because [I]172-philip see [you]172-philip will both be unhappy together . " [I]172-philip am not marrying [her]104-mrs. herriton because [she]104-mrs. herriton is rich , "[172-philip] was the sulky reply .

" [I]172-philip never suggested that for a moment , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip courteously . " [You]172-philip are honourable , [I]172-philip am sure ; but are [you]172-philip wise ? " Reward - what reward ? "[172-philip] [He]172-philip bent over the back of a chair and looked earnestly at [Philip]172-philip . [They]528-they were coming to terms pretty quickly . [Poor Lilia]100-lilia !

[Philip]172-philip said slowly , " What about a thousand lire ? "[172-philip]

[His]172-philip soul went forth into one exclamation , and then [he]172-philip was silent , with gaping lips . [Philip]172-philip would have given double : [he]172-philip had expected a bargain .

" [You]172-philip can have them tonight . "[172-philip]

[He]172-philip found words , and said , " It is too late . "[172-philip]

" But why ? "[172-philip]

" Because - "[172-philip] [His]172-philip voice broke . [Philip]172-philip watched [his]172-philip face , - a face without refinement perhaps , but not without expression , - watched it quiver and re - form and dissolve from emotion into emotion . There was avarice at one moment , and insolence , and politeness , and stupidity , and cunning - and let [us]529-us hope that sometimes there was love . But gradually one emotion dominated , the most unexpected of all ; for [his]172-philip chest began to heave and [his]172-philip eyes to wink and [his]172-philip mouth to twitch , and suddenly [he]172-philip stood erect and roared forth [his]172-philip whole being in one tremendous laugh .

[Philip]172-philip sprang up , and [Gino]144-gino , who had flung wide [his]144-gino arms to let [the glorious creature]530-the glorious creature go , took [him]172-philip by the shoulders and shook [him]172-philip , and said , " Because [we]529-us are married - married - married as soon as [I]144-gino knew [you]172-philip were , coming . There was no time to tell [you]172-philip . Oh . oh ! [You]172-philip have come all the way for nothing . Oh ! And oh , [your]172-philip generosity ! "[144-gino] Suddenly [he]172-philip became grave , and said , " Please pardon [me]172-philip ; [I]172-philip am rude . [I]172-philip am no better than [a peasant]1945-a peasant , and [I]172-philip - "[172-philip] Here [he]144-gino saw [Philip]172-philip 's face , and it was too much for [him]172-philip . [He]172-philip gasped and exploded and crammed [his]172-philip hands into [his]172-philip mouth and spat them out in another explosion , and gave [Philip]172-philip an aimless push , which toppled [him]172-philip on to the bed . [He]172-philip uttered a horrified Oh ! and then gave up , and bolted away down [the passage]1876-the passage , shrieking like [a child]309-a child , to tell the joke to [[his]172-philip wife]533-his wife .

For a time [Philip]172-philip lay on the bed , pretending to [himself]172-philip that [he]172-philip was hurt grievously . [He]172-philip could scarcely see for temper , and in [the passage]1876-the passage [he]172-philip ran against [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , who promptly burst into tears .

" [I]172-philip sleep at [the Globo]1946-the globo , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip told [her]107-miss abbott , " and start for [Sawston]23-sawston tomorrow morning early . [He]172-philip has assaulted [me]172-philip . [I]172-philip could prosecute [him]172-philip . But shall not . "[172-philip]

" [I]107-miss abbott ca n't stop here , "[107-miss abbott] [she]107-miss abbott sobbed . " [I]107-miss abbott dare n't stop here . [You]172-philip will have to take [me]107-miss abbott with [you]172-philip ! "[107-miss abbott]

Chapter 3

Opposite [the Volterra gate of [Monteriano]7-monteriano]535-the volterra gate of monteriano , outside [the city]460-the city , is a very respectable white - washed mud wall , with a coping of red crinkled tiles to keep [it]537-it from dissolution . It would suggest [[a gentleman]326-a gentleman 's garden]539-a gentleman 's garden if there was not in [its]537-it middle a large hole , which grows larger with every rain - storm . Through the hole is visible , firstly , the iron gate that is intended to close [it]537-it ; secondly , a square piece of ground which , though not quite , mud , is at the same time not exactly grass ; and finally , another wall , stone this time , which has a wooden door in the middle and two wooden - shuttered windows each side , and apparently forms the facade of [a one - storey house]540-a one - storey house .

[This house]541-this house is bigger than [it]541-this house looks , for [it]541-this house slides for two storeys down [the hill behind]542-the hill behind , and the wooden door , which is always locked , really leads into [the attic]1831-the attic . [The knowing person]544-the knowing person prefers to follow the precipitous mule - track round the turn of the mud wall till [he]544-the knowing person can take the edifice in the rear . Then - being now on a level with [the cellars]545-the cellars - [he]544-the knowing person lifts up [his]544-the knowing person head and shouts . If [his]544-the knowing person voice sounds like something light - a letter , for example , or some vegetables , or a bunch of flowers - a basket is let out of the first - floor windows by a string , into which [he]544-the knowing person puts [his]544-the knowing person burdens and departs . But if [he]544-the knowing person sounds like something heavy , such as a log of wood , or a piece of meat , or [a visitor]546-a visitor , [he]544-the knowing person is interrogated , and then bidden or forbidden to ascend . The ground floor and the upper floor of [that battered house]547-that battered house are alike deserted , and [the inmates]548-the inmates keep the central portion , just as in a dying body all life retires to the heart . There is a door at the top of the first flight of stairs , and if [the visitor]549-the visitor is admitted [he]549-the visitor will find a welcome which is not necessarily cold . There are [several rooms]550-several rooms , [some dark and mostly stuffy]551-some dark and mostly stuffy - [a reception - room]552-a reception - room adorned with horsehair chairs , wool - work stools , and a stove that is never lit - German bad taste without German domesticity broods over [that room]553-that room ; also [a living - room]554-a living - room , which insensibly glides into [a bedroom]555-a bedroom when the refining influence of hospitality is absent , and [real bedrooms]556-real bedrooms ; and last , but not least , the loggia , where [you]557-you can live day and night if [you]557-you feel inclined , drinking vermouth and smoking cigarettes , with leagues of olive - trees and vineyards and [blue - green hills]558-blue - green hills to watch [you]557-you .

It was in [this house]541-this house that the brief and inevitable tragedy of [Lilia]100-lilia 's married life took place . [She]100-lilia made [Gino]144-gino buy it for [her]100-lilia , because it was there [she]100-lilia had first seen [him]144-gino sitting on the mud wall that faced the Volterra gate . [She]100-lilia remembered how the evening sun had struck [his]144-gino hair , and how [he]144-gino had smiled down at [her]100-lilia , and being both sentimental and unrefined , was determined to have [the man]370-the man and [the place]280-the place together . Things in [Italy]8-italy are cheap for [an Italian]562-an italian , and , though [he]144-gino would have preferred [a house in [the piazza]564-the piazza]563-a house in the piazza , or better still [a house at [Siena]31-siena]565-a house at siena , or , bliss above bliss , [a house at [Leghorn]56-leghorn]566-a house at leghorn , [he]144-gino did as [she]100-lilia asked , thinking that perhaps [she]100-lilia showed [her]100-lilia good taste in preferring so retired an abode .

[The house]251-the house was far too big for [them]568-them , and there was [a general concourse of [[his]144-gino relatives]570-his relatives]569-a general concourse of his relatives to fill [it]251-the house up . [[His]144-gino father]1863-his father wished to make it a patriarchal concern , where all [the family]266-the family should have [[their]266-the family rooms]573-their rooms and meet together for meals , and was perfectly willing to give up the new practice at [Poggibonsi]41-poggibonsi and preside . [Gino]144-gino was quite willing too , for [he]144-gino was [an affectionate youth who liked a large [home - circle]575-home - circle]574-an affectionate youth who liked a large home - circle , and [he]144-gino told it as a pleasant bit of news to [Lilia]100-lilia , who did not attempt to conceal [her]100-lilia horror .

At once [he]144-gino was horrified too ; saw that the idea was monstrous ; abused [himself]144-gino to [her]100-lilia for having suggested it ; rushed off to tell [[his]144-gino father]1863-his father that it was impossible . [[His]144-gino father]1863-his father complained that prosperity was already corrupting [him]144-gino and making [him]144-gino unsympathetic and hard ; [[his]144-gino mother]307-his mother cried ; [[his]144-gino sisters]579-his sisters accused [him]144-gino of blocking [their]579-his sisters social advance . [He]144-gino was apologetic , and even cringing , until [they]579-his sisters turned on [Lilia]100-lilia . Then [he]144-gino turned on [them]579-his sisters , saying that [they]579-his sisters could not understand , much less associate with , [the English lady who was [[his]144-gino wife]533-his wife ; that there should be one master in [that house]582-that house - [himself]144-gino]580-the english lady who was his wife ; that there should be one master in that house - himself .

[Lilia]100-lilia praised and petted [him]144-gino on [his]144-gino return , calling [him]144-gino brave and [a hero]583-a hero and other endearing epithets . But [he]144-gino was rather blue when [[his]144-gino clan]584-his clan left [Monteriano]7-monteriano in much dignity - a dignity which was not at all impaired by the acceptance of a cheque . [They]584-his clan took the cheque not to [Poggibonsi]41-poggibonsi , after all , but to [Empoli]57-empoli - [a lively , dusty town some twenty miles off]585-a lively , dusty town some twenty miles off . There [they]584-his clan settled down in comfort , and [the sisters]586-the sisters said [they]584-his clan had been driven to it by [Gino]144-gino .

The cheque was , of course , [Lilia]100-lilia 's , who was extremely generous , and was quite willing to know [anybody]587-anybody so long as [she]100-lilia had not to live with [them]587-anybody , [relations - in - law]588-relations - in - law being on [her]100-lilia nerves . [She]100-lilia liked nothing better than finding out some obscure and distant connection - there were several of [them]587-anybody - and acting [the lady]1752-the lady bountiful , leaving behind [her]1752-the lady bewilderment , and too often discontent . [Gino]144-gino wondered how it was that all [[his]144-gino people]1857-his people , who had formerly seemed so pleasant , had suddenly become plaintive and disagreeable . [He]144-gino put it down to [[his]144-gino lady wife]591-his lady wife 's magnificence , in comparison with which all seemed common . [Her]591-his lady wife money flew apace , in spite of the cheap living . [She]591-his lady wife was even richer than [he]144-gino expected ; and [he]144-gino remembered with shame how [he]144-gino had once regretted [his]144-gino inability to accept the thousand lire that [Philip Herriton]172-philip offered [him]144-gino in exchange for [her]591-his lady wife . It would have been a shortsighted bargain .

[Lilia]100-lilia enjoyed settling into [the house]251-the house , with nothing to do except give orders to [smiling workpeople]593-smiling workpeople , and [a devoted husband]594-a devoted husband as [interpreter]595-interpreter . [She]100-lilia wrote a jaunty account of [her]100-lilia happiness to [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , and [Harriet]102-harriet answered the letter , saying 1 that all future communications should be addressed to [the solicitors]596-the solicitors ; 2 would [Lilia]100-lilia return an inlaid box which [Harriet]102-harriet had lent [her]100-lilia - but not given - to keep handkerchiefs and collars in ?

" Look what [I]100-lilia am giving up to live with [you]144-gino ! "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia said to [Gino]144-gino , never omitting to lay stress on [her]100-lilia condescension . [He]144-gino took [her]100-lilia to mean the inlaid box , and said that [she]100-lilia need not give it up at all .

" [Silly fellow]1947-silly fellow , no ! [I]100-lilia mean the life . [Those Herritons]147-the herritons are very well connected . [They]147-the herritons lead [Sawston]23-sawston society . But what do [I]100-lilia care , so long as [I]100-lilia have [[my]100-lilia silly fellow]1948-my silly fellow ! "[100-lilia] [She]100-lilia always treated [him]144-gino as [a boy]597-a boy , which [he]144-gino was , and as [a fool]1928-a fool , which [he]144-gino was not , thinking [herself]100-lilia so immeasurably superior to [him]144-gino that [she]100-lilia neglected opportunity after opportunity of establishing [her]100-lilia rule . [He]144-gino was good - looking and indolent ; therefore [he]144-gino must be stupid . [He]144-gino was poor ; therefore [he]144-gino would never dare to criticize [[his]144-gino benefactress]599-his benefactress . [He]144-gino was passionately in love with [her]100-lilia ; therefore [she]100-lilia could do exactly as [she]100-lilia liked .

" It may n't be [heaven below]1949-heaven below , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia thought , " but it 's better than [Charles]111-charles . "[100-lilia]

And all the time [the boy]600-the boy was watching [her]100-lilia , and growing up .

[She]100-lilia was reminded of [Charles]111-charles by a disagreeable letter from [the solicitors]596-the solicitors , bidding [her]100-lilia disgorge a large sum of money for [Irma]103-irma , in accordance with [[her]100-lilia late husband]602-her late husband 's will . It was just like [Charles]111-charles 's suspicious nature to have provided against a second marriage . [Gino]144-gino was equally indignant , and between [them]603-them [they]603-them composed a stinging reply , which had no effect . [He]144-gino then said that [Irma]103-irma had better come out and live with [them]603-them . " The air is good , so is the food ; [she]103-irma will be happy here , and [we]603-them shall not have to part with the money . "[144-gino] But [Lilia]100-lilia had not the courage even to suggest this to [the Herritons]147-the herritons , and an unexpected terror seized [her]100-lilia at the thought of [Irma]103-irma or [any English child]604-any english child being educated at [Monteriano]7-monteriano .

[Gino]144-gino became terribly depressed over [the solicitors]596-the solicitors ' letter , more depressed than [she]100-lilia thought necessary . There was no more to do in [the house]251-the house , and [he]144-gino spent whole days in [the loggia]607-the loggia leaning over the parapet or sitting astride [it]607-the loggia disconsolately .

" Oh , [[you]144-gino idle boy]1950-you idle boy ! "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia cried , pinching [his]144-gino muscles . " Go and play pallone . "[100-lilia]

" [I]144-gino am [a married man]1951-a married man , "[144-gino] [he]144-gino answered , without raising [his]144-gino head . " [I]144-gino do not play games any more . "[144-gino]

" Go and see [[your]144-gino friends]1952-your friends then . "[100-lilia]

" [I]144-gino have [no friends]1953-no friends now . "[144-gino]

" Silly , silly , silly ! [You]144-gino ca n't stop indoors all day ! "[100-lilia]

" [I]144-gino want to see [no one]1773-no one but [you]144-gino . "[144-gino] [He]144-gino spat on to an olive - tree .

" Now , [Gino]144-gino , do n't be silly . Go and see [[your]144-gino friends]1952-your friends , and bring [them]1952-your friends to see [me]100-lilia . [We]1956-we both of [us]1956-we like [society]1957-society . "[100-lilia]

[He]144-gino looked puzzled , but allowed [himself]144-gino to be persuaded , went out , found that [he]144-gino was not as friendless as [he]144-gino supposed , and returned after several hours in altered spirits . [Lilia]100-lilia congratulated [herself]100-lilia on [her]100-lilia good management .

" [I]100-lilia 'm ready , too , for [people]1776-people now , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia said . " [I]100-lilia mean to wake [you]144-gino all up , just as [I]100-lilia woke up [Sawston]23-sawston . Let 's have plenty of [men]1959-men - and make [them]1952-your friends bring [[their]1952-your friends womenkind]1960-their womenkind . [I]100-lilia mean to have real English tea - parties . "[100-lilia]

" There is [[my]100-lilia aunt]1961-my aunt and [[her]1961-my aunt husband]1962-her husband ; but [I]100-lilia thought [you]608-he did not want to receive [[my]100-lilia relatives]1963-my relatives . "[100-lilia]

" [I]100-lilia never said such a - "[100-lilia]

" But [you]100-lilia would be right , "[608-he] [he]608-he said earnestly . " [They]1963-my relatives are not for [you]100-lilia . Many of [them]1963-my relatives are in trade , and even [we]1964-we are [little more]1965-little more ; [you]100-lilia should have [gentlefolk]1966-gentlefolk and [nobility]1967-nobility for [[your]100-lilia friends]1952-your friends . "[608-he]

" [Poor fellow]1969-poor fellow , "[100-lilia] thought [Lilia]100-lilia . " It is sad for [him]608-he to discover that [[his]608-he people]1857-his people are vulgar . "[100-lilia] [She]100-lilia began to tell [him]608-he that [she]100-lilia loved [him]608-he just for [his]608-he silly self , and [he]608-he flushed and began tugging at [his]608-he moustache .

" But besides [[your]100-lilia relatives]1971-your relatives [I]100-lilia must have [other people]1972-other people here . [[Your]100-lilia friends]1952-your friends have [wives]1974-wives and [sisters]1975-sisters , have n't [they]1952-your friends ? "[100-lilia]

" Oh , yes ; but of course [I]100-lilia scarcely know [them]1952-your friends . "[100-lilia]

" Not know [[[your]100-lilia friends]1952-your friends ' people]1977-your friends ' people ? "[100-lilia]

" Why , no . If [they]1952-your friends are poor and have to work for [their]1952-your friends living [I]608-he may see [them]1952-your friends - but not otherwise . Except - "[608-he] [He]608-he stopped . [The chief exception]609-the chief exception was [a young lady , to whom [he]608-he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes . But the dowry had proved inadequate , and [the acquaintance]611-the acquaintance terminated .

" How funny ! But [I]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes mean to change all that . "[610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes]

[He]608-he looked at [her]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes rather hopelessly .

" Well , who are [the principal people here]1980-the principal people here ? Who leads [society]1957-society ? "[608-he]

[The governor of [the prison]613-the prison]612-the governor of the prison , [he]608-he supposed , and [the officers who assisted [him]608-he]614-the officers who assisted him .

" [I]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes see , "[610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes] [she]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes exclaimed angrily . " [They]1952-your friends look down on [you]608-he , do [they]1952-your friends , [poor boy]1983-poor boy ? Wait ! "[610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes] [He]608-he assented . " Wait ! [I]608-he 'll soon stop that . Now , who else is there ? "[608-he]

" [The marchese]1984-the marchese , sometimes , and [the canons of [the Collegiate Church]1986-the collegiate church]1985-the canons of the collegiate church . "[608-he]

" [The canons]1988-the canons - "[608-he] [he]608-he began with twinkling eyes .

" Oh , [I]608-he forgot [your]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes horrid celibacy . In [England]20-england [they]1988-the canons would be the centre of everything . But why should n't [I]608-he know [them]1988-the canons ? Would it make it easier if [I]608-he called all round ?
