[He]608-he did not think it would make it easier .

" But [I]608-he must know [some one]1989-some one ! Who were [the men [you]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes were talking to]1990-the men you were talking to this afternoon ? "[608-he]

[Low - class men]615-low - class men . [He]608-he could scarcely recollect [their]615-low - class men names .

" But , [[Gino]144-gino dear]1991-gino dear , if [they]615-low - class men 're [low class]1992-low class , why did [you]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes talk to [them]615-low - class men ? Do n't [you]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes care about [your]610-a young lady , to whom he had once been introduced for matrimonial purposes position ? "[144-gino]

All [Gino]144-gino cared about at present was idleness and pocket - money , and [his]144-gino way of expressing it was to exclaim , " Ouf - pouf ! How hot it is in here . No air ; [I]144-gino sweat all over . [I]144-gino expire . [I]144-gino must cool [myself]144-gino , or [I]144-gino shall never get to sleep . "[144-gino] In [his]144-gino funny abrupt way [he]144-gino ran out on to [the loggia]607-the loggia , where [he]144-gino lay full length on the parapet , and began to smoke and spit under the silence of the stars .

[Lilia]100-lilia gathered somehow from this conversation that Continental society was not the go - as - [you]617-you - please thing [she]100-lilia had expected . Indeed [she]100-lilia could not see where [Continental society]618-continental society was . [Italy]8-italy is such [a delightful place to live in if [you]617-you happen to be [a man]1757-a man]619-a delightful place to live in if you happen to be a man . There [one]289-one may enjoy that exquisite luxury of [Socialism]58-socialism - that true Socialism which is based not on equality of income or character , but on the equality of manners . In the democracy of [the caffe]622-the caffe or [the street]623-the street the great question of [our]624-our life has been solved , and the brotherhood of [man]625-man is a reality . But is accomplished at the expense of [the sisterhood of [women]490-women]626-the sisterhood of women . Why should [you]617-you not make friends with [[your]617-you neighbour]628-your neighbour at [the theatre]629-the theatre or in [the train]237-the train , when [you]617-you know and [he]628-your neighbour knows that feminine criticism and feminine insight and feminine prejudice will never come between [you]617-you ? Though [you]617-you become as [David]148-david and [Jonathan]149-jonathan , [you]617-you need never enter [[his]628-your neighbour home]631-his home , nor [he]628-your neighbour [yours]617-you . All [your]617-you lives [you]617-you will meet under the open air , the only roof - tree of [the South]632-the south , under which [he]628-your neighbour will spit and swear , and [you]617-you will drop [your]617-you h 's , and [nobody]633-nobody will think the worse of either .

Meanwhile [the women]634-the women - [they]634-the women have , of course , [[their]634-the women house]635-their house and [[their]634-the women church]636-their church , with [its]636-their church admirable and frequent services , to which [they]634-the women are escorted by [the maid]637-the maid . Otherwise [they]634-the women do not go out much , for it is not genteel to walk , and [you]617-you are too poor to keep [a carriage]638-a carriage . Occasionally [you]617-you will take [them]634-the women to [the caffe or theatre]639-the caffe or theatre , and immediately all [your]617-you wonted acquaintance there desert [you]617-you , except [those few who are expecting and expected to marry into [[your]617-you family]641-your family]640-those few who are expecting and expected to marry into your family . It is all very sad . But one consolation emerges - life is very pleasant in [Italy]8-italy if [you]617-you are [a man]1757-a man .

Hitherto [Gino]144-gino had not interfered with [Lilia]100-lilia . [She]100-lilia was so much older than [he]144-gino was , and so much richer , that [he]144-gino regarded [her]100-lilia as a superior being who answered to other laws . [He]144-gino was not wholly surprised , for strange rumours were always blowing over [the Alps of lands where [men]1959-men and [women]490-women]643-the alps of lands where men and women had the same amusements and interests , and [he]144-gino had often met [that privileged maniac]646-that privileged maniac , [the lady tourist]647-the lady tourist , on [her]646-that privileged maniac solitary walks . [Lilia]100-lilia took solitary walks too , and only that week [a tramp]648-a tramp had grabbed at [her]100-lilia watch - an episode which is supposed to be indigenous in [Italy]8-italy , though really less frequent there than in [Bond Street]59-bond street . Now that [he]144-gino knew [her]100-lilia better , [he]144-gino was inevitably losing [his]144-gino awe : [no one]1773-no one could live with [her]100-lilia and keep it , especially when [she]100-lilia had been so silly as to lose a gold watch and chain . As [he]144-gino lay thoughtful along the parapet , [he]144-gino realized for the first time the responsibilities of monied life . [He]144-gino must save [her]100-lilia from dangers , physical and social , for after all [she]100-lilia was [a woman]406-a woman . " And [I]144-gino , "[144-gino] [he]144-gino reflected , " though [I]144-gino am young , am at all events [a man]1757-a man , and know what is right . "[144-gino]

[He]144-gino found [her]100-lilia still in [the living - room]651-the living - room , combing [her]100-lilia hair , for [she]100-lilia had something of the slattern in [her]100-lilia nature , and there was no need to keep up appearances .

" [You]100-lilia must not go out alone , "[144-gino] [he]144-gino said gently . " It is not safe . If [you]100-lilia want to walk , [Perfetta]150-perfetta shall accompany [you]100-lilia . "[144-gino] [Perfetta]150-perfetta was [a widowed cousin]652-a widowed cousin , too humble for social aspirations , who was living with [them]653-them as [factotum]654-factotum .

" Very well , "[100-lilia] smiled [Lilia]100-lilia , " very well "[100-lilia] - as if [she]100-lilia were addressing [a solicitous kitten]655-a solicitous kitten . But for all that [she]100-lilia never took a solitary walk again , with one exception , till the day of [her]100-lilia death .

Days passed , and [no one]1773-no one called except [poor relatives]657-poor relatives . [She]100-lilia began to feel dull . Did n't [he]144-gino know [the Sindaco]658-the sindaco or [the bank manager]659-the bank manager ? Even [the landlady of [the Stella d'Italia]661-the stella d'italia]660-the landlady of the stella d'italia would be better than [no one]1773-no one . [She]100-lilia , when [she]100-lilia went into [the town]461-the town , was pleasantly received ; but [people]1776-people naturally found a difficulty in getting on with [a lady who could not learn [their]1776-people language]665-a lady who could not learn their language . And the tea - party , under [[Gino]144-gino 's adroit management]666-gino 's adroit management , receded ever and ever before [her]100-lilia .

[He]144-gino had a good deal of anxiety over [her]100-lilia welfare , for [she]100-lilia did not settle down in [the house]251-the house at all . But [he]144-gino was comforted by [a welcome and unexpected visitor]668-a welcome and unexpected visitor . As [he]144-gino was going one afternoon for the letters - they were delivered at the door , but it took longer to get [them]669-them at [the office]670-the office - [some one]1989-some one humorously threw a cloak over [his]1989-some one head , and when [he]144-gino disengaged [himself]144-gino [he]144-gino saw [[his]144-gino very dear friend Spiridione Tesi of [the custom - house at [Chiasso]60-chiasso]673-the custom - house at chiasso , whom [he]144-gino had not met for two years . What joy ! what salutations ! so that [all the passersby]674-all the passersby smiled with approval on the amiable scene . [[Spiridione]151-spiridione 's brother]675-spiridione 's brother]672-his very dear friend spiridione tesi of the custom - house at chiasso , whom he had not met for two years . what joy ! what salutations ! so that all the passersby smiled with approval on the amiable scene . spiridione 's brother was now [station - master at [Bologna]61-bologna]676-station - master at bologna , and thus [he]144-gino [himself]144-gino could spend [his]144-gino holiday travelling over [Italy]8-italy at the public expense . Hearing of [Gino]144-gino 's marriage , [he]144-gino had come to see [him]144-gino on [his]144-gino way to [Siena]31-siena , where lived [[his]144-gino own uncle]677-his own uncle , lately monied too .

" [They]674-all the passersby all do it , "[144-gino] [he]144-gino exclaimed , " [myself]144-gino excepted . "[144-gino] [He]144-gino was not quite twenty - three . " But tell [me]144-gino more . [She]1994-she is English . That is good , very good . [An English wife]1995-an english wife is very good indeed . And [she]1994-she is rich ? "[144-gino]

" Immensely rich . "[144-gino]

" Blonde or dark ? "[144-gino]

" [Blonde]152-blonde . "[144-gino]

" Is it possible ! "[144-gino]

" It pleases [me]144-gino very much , "[144-gino] said [Gino]144-gino simply . " If [you]144-gino remember , [I]144-gino always desired [a blonde]1996-a blonde . "[144-gino] [Three or four men]678-three or four men had collected , and were listening .

" [We]674-all the passersby all desire one , "[151-spiridione] said [Spiridione]151-spiridione . " But [you]144-gino , [Gino]144-gino , deserve [your]144-gino good fortune , for [you]144-gino are [a good son]1997-a good son , [a brave man]1998-a brave man , and [a true friend]1999-a true friend , and from the very first moment [I]151-spiridione saw [you]144-gino [I]151-spiridione wished [you]144-gino well . "[151-spiridione]

" No compliments , [I]144-gino beg , "[144-gino] said [Gino]144-gino , standing with [his]144-gino hands crossed on [his]144-gino chest and a smile of pleasure on [his]144-gino face .

[Spiridione]151-spiridione addressed [the other men]679-the other men , [none of whom [he]151-spiridione had ever seen before]680-none of whom he had ever seen before . " Is it not true ? Does not [he]151-spiridione deserve [this wealthy blonde]2000-this wealthy blonde ? "[679-the other men]

" [He]151-spiridione does deserve [her]2000-this wealthy blonde , "[681-all the men] said [all the men]681-all the men .

It is [a marvellous land]682-a marvellous land , where [you]683-you love it or hate it .

There were no letters , and of course [they]681-all the men sat down at [the Caffe Garibaldi]62-the caffe garibaldi , by [the Collegiate Church]1986-the collegiate church - quite a good caffe that for so small [a city]685-a city . There were marble - topped tables , and pillars terra - cotta below and gold above , and on the ceiling was a fresco of the battle of [Solferino]63-solferino . [One]289-one could not have desired [a prettier room]687-a prettier room . [They]681-all the men had vermouth and little cakes with sugar on the top , which [they]681-all the men chose gravely at the counter , pinching [them]688-them first to be sure [they]688-them were fresh . And though vermouth is barely alcoholic , [Spiridione]151-spiridione drenched [his]151-spiridione with soda - water to be sure that it should not get into [his]151-spiridione head .

[They]681-all the men were in high spirits , and elaborate compliments alternated curiously with gentle horseplay . But soon [they]681-all the men put up [their]681-all the men legs on a pair of chairs and began to smoke .

" Tell [me]151-spiridione , "[151-spiridione] said [Spiridione]151-spiridione - " [I]151-spiridione forgot to ask - is [she]2001-she young ? "[151-spiridione]

" Thirty - three . "[144-gino]

" Ah , well , [we]681-all the men can not have everything . "[151-spiridione]

" But [you]144-gino would be surprised . Had [she]2001-she told [me]144-gino twenty - eight , [I]144-gino should not have disbelieved [her]2001-she . "[144-gino]

" Is [she]2001-she [SIMPATICA]153-simpatica ? "[151-spiridione] Nothing will translate that word .

[Gino]144-gino dabbed at the sugar and said after a silence , " Sufficiently so . "[144-gino]

" It is a most important thing . "[144-gino]

" [She]2001-she is rich , [she]2001-she is generous , [she]2001-she is affable , [she]2001-she addresses [[her]2001-she inferiors]2002-her inferiors without haughtiness . "[144-gino]

There was another silence . " It is not sufficient , "[470-the other] said [the other]470-the other . " [One]289-one does not define it thus . "[144-gino] [He]144-gino lowered [his]144-gino voice to a whisper . " Last month [a German]2004-a german was smuggling cigars . [The custom - house]2005-the custom - house was dark . " [I]144-gino do not accept small sums now . It is not worth the risk . But [the German]2007-the german was another matter . " [One]289-one [I]144-gino have seen who may be so . [She]289-one spoke very little , but [she]289-one was [a young lady]2015-a young lady - different to most . [He]144-gino was very angry . "[144-gino]

Then [he]144-gino spoke of [his]144-gino exciting and secret marriage , and [they]690-they made fun of the unfortunate [Philip]172-philip , who had travelled over [Europe]19-europe to stop it .

" [I]144-gino regret though , "[144-gino] said [Gino]144-gino , when [they]690-they had finished laughing , " that [I]144-gino toppled [him]144-gino on to the bed . [A great tall man]2019-a great tall man ! And when [I]144-gino am really amused [I]144-gino am often impolite . "[144-gino]

" [You]151-spiridione will never see [him]144-gino again , "[151-spiridione] said [Spiridione]151-spiridione , who carried plenty of philosophy about [him]151-spiridione . " And by now the scene will have passed from [his]144-gino mind . "[151-spiridione]

" It sometimes happens that such things are recollected longest . [I]144-gino shall never see [him]144-gino again , of course ; but it is no benefit to [me]144-gino that [he]144-gino should wish [me]144-gino ill . And even if [he]144-gino has forgotten , [I]144-gino am still sorry that [I]144-gino toppled [him]144-gino on to the bed . "[144-gino]

So [their]690-they talk continued , at one moment full of childishness and tender wisdom , the next moment scandalously gross . The shadows of the terra - cotta pillars lengthened , and [tourists]691-tourists , flying through [the Palazzo Pubblico opposite]692-the palazzo pubblico opposite , could observe how [the Italians]1789-the italians wasted time .

The sight of [tourists]691-tourists reminded [Gino]144-gino of something [he]144-gino might say . " [I]144-gino want to consult [you]144-gino since [you]144-gino are so kind as to take an interest in [my]144-gino affairs . [[My]144-gino wife]2017-my wife wishes to take solitary walks . "[144-gino]

[Spiridione]151-spiridione was shocked .

" But [I]144-gino have forbidden [her]2017-my wife . "[144-gino]

" Naturally . "[151-spiridione]

" [She]2017-my wife does not yet understand . [She]2017-my wife asked [me]144-gino to accompany [her]2017-my wife sometimes - to walk without object ! [You]144-gino know , [she]2017-my wife would like [me]144-gino to be with [her]2017-my wife all day . "[144-gino]

" [I]151-spiridione see . [I]151-spiridione see . "[151-spiridione] [He]151-spiridione knitted [his]151-spiridione brows and tried to think how [he]151-spiridione could help [[his]151-spiridione friend]695-his friend . " [She]2017-my wife needs employment . Is [she]2017-my wife [a Catholic]2021-a catholic ? "[151-spiridione]

" No . "[144-gino]

" That is a pity . [She]2017-my wife must be persuaded . It will be a great solace to [her]2017-my wife when [she]2017-my wife is alone . "[151-spiridione]

" [I]144-gino am [a Catholic]2021-a catholic , but of course [I]144-gino never go to [church]2023-church . "[144-gino]

" Of course not . Still , [you]151-spiridione might take [her]2017-my wife at first . [He]2024-my brother took [her]2017-my wife once or twice [himself]2024-my brother , and now [she]2017-my wife has acquired the habit and continues to go without [him]2024-my brother . "[151-spiridione]

" Most excellent advice , and [I]144-gino thank [you]151-spiridione for it . But [she]2017-my wife wishes to give tea - parties - [men]1959-men and [women]490-women together whom [she]2017-my wife has never seen . "[144-gino]

" Oh , [the English]2029-the english ! [they]2029-the english are always thinking of tea . [They]2029-the english carry it by the kilogramme in [their]2029-the english trunks , and [they]2029-the english are so clumsy that [they]2029-the english always pack it at the top . But it is absurd ! "[151-spiridione]

" What am [I]144-gino to do about it ? "[144-gino]

" Do nothing . Or ask [me]151-spiridione ! "[151-spiridione]

" Come ! "[144-gino] cried [Gino]144-gino , springing up . " [She]2017-my wife will be quite pleased . "[144-gino]

[The dashing young fellow]696-the dashing young fellow coloured crimson . " Of course [I]696-the dashing young fellow was only joking . "[696-the dashing young fellow]

" [I]151-spiridione know . But [she]2017-my wife wants [me]151-spiridione to take [[my]151-spiridione friends]2030-my friends . Come now ! [Waiter]2031-waiter ! "[151-spiridione]

" If [I]470-the other do come , "[470-the other] cried [the other]470-the other , " and take tea with [you]144-gino , this bill must be [my]470-the other affair . "[470-the other]

" Certainly not ; [you]144-gino are in [[my]151-spiridione country]2032-my country ! "[151-spiridione]

A long argument ensued , in which [the waiter]698-the waiter took part , suggesting various solutions . At last [Gino]144-gino triumphed . The bill came to eightpence - halfpenny , and a halfpenny for [the waiter]698-the waiter brought it up to ninepence . Then there was a shower of gratitude on one side and of deprecation on the other , and when [courtesies]700-courtesies were at [their]700-courtesies height [they]700-courtesies suddenly linked arms and swung down [the street]623-the street , tickling [each other]487-each other with lemonade straws as [they]700-courtesies went .

[Lilia]100-lilia was delighted to see [them]700-courtesies , and became more animated than [Gino]144-gino had known [her]100-lilia for a long time . The tea tasted of chopped hay , and [they]700-courtesies asked to be allowed to drink it out of a wine - glass , and refused milk ; but , as [she]100-lilia repeatedly observed , this was something like . [Spiridione]151-spiridione 's manners were very agreeable . [He]144-gino kissed [her]100-lilia hand on introduction , and as [his]144-gino profession had taught [him]144-gino a little English , conversation did not flag .

" Do [you]144-gino like music ? "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia asked .

" Passionately , "[144-gino] [he]144-gino replied . " [I]144-gino have not studied scientific music , but the music of the heart , yes . "[144-gino]

So [she]100-lilia played on the humming piano very badly , and [he]144-gino sang , not so badly . [Gino]144-gino got out a guitar and sang too , sitting out on [the loggia]607-the loggia . It was a most agreeable visit .

[Gino]144-gino said [he]144-gino would just walk [[his]144-gino friend]695-his friend back to [[his]144-gino lodgings]705-his lodgings . As [they]706-they went [he]144-gino said , without the least trace of malice or satire in [his]144-gino voice , " [I]144-gino think [you]100-lilia are quite right . [I]144-gino shall not bring [people]1776-people to [the house]251-the house any more . [I]144-gino do not see why [an English wife]1995-an english wife should be treated differently . This is [Italy]8-italy . "[144-gino]

" [You]100-lilia are very wise , "[470-the other] exclaimed [the other]470-the other ; " very wise indeed . The more precious a possession the more carefully it should be guarded . "[470-the other]

[They]706-they had reached [the lodging]708-the lodging , but went on as far as [the Caffe Garibaldi]709-the caffe garibaldi , where [they]706-they spent a long and most delightful evening .

Chapter 4

The advance of regret can be so gradual that it is impossible to say " yesterday [I]100-lilia was happy , today [I]100-lilia am not . "[100-lilia] At no one moment did [Lilia]100-lilia realize that [her]100-lilia marriage was a failure ; yet during the summer and autumn [she]100-lilia became as unhappy as it was possible for [her]100-lilia nature to be . [She]100-lilia had no unkind treatment , and few unkind words , from [[her]100-lilia husband]1962-her husband . [He]1962-her husband simply left [her]100-lilia alone . In the morning [he]1962-her husband went out to do " business , "[1962-her husband] which , as far as [she]100-lilia could discover , meant sitting in [the Farmacia]65-the farmacia . [He]1962-her husband usually returned to lunch , after which [he]1962-her husband retired to [another room]711-another room and slept . In the evening [he]1962-her husband grew vigorous again , and took the air on [the ramparts]712-the ramparts , often having [his]1962-her husband dinner out , and seldom returning till midnight or later . There were , of course , the times when [he]1962-her husband was away altogether - at [Empoli]57-empoli , [Siena]31-siena , [Florence]24-florence , [Bologna]61-bologna - for [he]1962-her husband delighted in travel , and seemed to pick up [friends]713-friends all over [the country]1732-the country . [Lilia]100-lilia often heard what [a favorite]715-a favorite [he]1962-her husband was .

[She]100-lilia began to see that [she]100-lilia must assert [herself]100-lilia , but [she]100-lilia could not see how . [Her]100-lilia self - confidence , which had overthrown [Philip]172-philip , had gradually oozed away . If [she]100-lilia left [the strange house]716-the strange house there was [the strange little town]717-the strange little town . If [she]100-lilia were to disobey [[her]100-lilia husband]1962-her husband and walk in [the country]1732-the country , that would be stranger still - [vast slopes of olives and vineyards]720-vast slopes of olives and vineyards , with [chalk - white farms]721-chalk - white farms , and in the distance other slopes , with more olives and [more farms]722-more farms , and [more little towns]723-more little towns outlined against the cloudless sky . " [I]100-lilia do n't call [this country]2036-this country , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia would say . " Why , it 's not as wild as [Sawston Park]66-sawston park ! "[100-lilia] And , indeed , there was scarcely a touch of wildness in it - some of [those slopes]724-those slopes had been under cultivation for two thousand years . But it was terrible and mysterious all the same , and its continued presence made [Lilia]100-lilia so uncomfortable that [she]100-lilia forgot [her]100-lilia nature and began to reflect .

[She]100-lilia reflected chiefly about [her]100-lilia marriage . The ceremony had been hasty and expensive , and the rites , whatever they were , were not those of [the Church of [England]20-england]725-the church of england . [Lilia]100-lilia had no religion in [her]100-lilia ; but for hours at a time [she]100-lilia would be seized with a vulgar fear that [she]100-lilia was not " married properly , "[100-lilia] and that [her]100-lilia social position in [the next world]726-the next world might be as obscure as it was in this . It might be safer to do the thing thoroughly , and one day [she]100-lilia took the advice of [Spiridione]151-spiridione and joined [the Roman Catholic Church]727-the roman catholic church , or as [she]100-lilia called it , " Santa Deodata 's . "[100-lilia] [Gino]144-gino approved ; [he]144-gino , too , thought it safer , and it was fun confessing , though [the priest]728-the priest was [a stupid old man]729-a stupid old man , and the whole thing was a good slap in the face for [[the people]1735-the people at [home]334-home]731-the people at home .

[The people at [home]334-home]731-the people at home took the slap very soberly ; indeed , there were few left for [her]100-lilia to give it to . [The Herritons]147-the herritons were out of the question ; [they]147-the herritons would not even let [her]100-lilia write to [Irma]103-irma , though [Irma]103-irma was occasionally allowed to write to [her]100-lilia . [Mrs. Theobald]105-mrs. theobald was rapidly subsiding into dotage , and , as far as [she]105-mrs. theobald could be definite about anything , had definitely sided with [the Herritons]147-the herritons . And [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott did likewise . Night after night did [Lilia]100-lilia curse [this false friend , who had agreed with [her]100-lilia that the marriage would " do , "[107-miss abbott] and that [the Herritons]147-the herritons]735-this false friend , who had agreed with her that the marriage would " do , " and that the herritons would come round to it , and then , at the first hint of opposition , had fled back to [England]20-england shrieking and distraught . [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott headed the long list of [those who should never be written to , and who should never be forgiven]736-those who should never be written to , and who should never be forgiven . [Almost]156-almost [the only person who was not on that list]737-the only person who was not on that list was [Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft , who had unexpectedly sent an affectionate and inquiring letter . [He]106-mr. kingcroft was quite sure never to cross [the Channel]738-the channel , and [Lilia]100-lilia drew freely on [her]100-lilia fancy in the reply .

At first [she]100-lilia had seen [a few English people]739-a few english people , for [Monteriano]7-monteriano was not [the end of [the earth]741-the earth]740-the end of the earth . [One or two inquisitive ladies , who had heard at [home]334-home of [her]100-lilia quarrel with [the Herritons]147-the herritons]742-one or two inquisitive ladies , who had heard at home of her quarrel with the herritons , came to call . [She]100-lilia was very sprightly , and [they]742-one or two inquisitive ladies , who had heard at home of her quarrel with the herritons thought [her]100-lilia quite unconventional , and [Gino]144-gino [a charming boy]744-a charming boy , so all that was to the good . But by May the season , such as it was , had finished , and there would be [no one]1773-no one till next spring . As [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton had often observed , [Lilia]100-lilia had no resources . [She]100-lilia did not like music , or reading , or work . [Her]100-lilia one qualification for life was rather blowsy high spirits , which turned querulous or boisterous according to circumstances . [She]100-lilia was not obedient , but [she]100-lilia was cowardly , and in the most gentle way , which [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton might have envied , [Gino]144-gino made [her]100-lilia do what [he]144-gino wanted . At first it had been rather fun to let [him]144-gino get the upper hand . But it was galling to discover that [he]144-gino could not do otherwise . [He]144-gino had a good strong will when [he]144-gino chose to use it , and would not have had the least scruple in using bolts and locks to put it into effect . There was plenty of brutality deep down in [him]144-gino , and one day [Lilia]100-lilia nearly touched it .

It was the old question of going out alone .

" [I]144-gino always do it in [England]20-england . "[144-gino]

" This is [Italy]8-italy . "[144-gino]

" Yes , but [I]144-gino 'm older than [you]100-lilia , and [I]144-gino 'll settle . "[144-gino]

" [I]144-gino am [[your]100-lilia husband]2037-your husband , "[144-gino] [he]144-gino said , smiling . [They]746-they had finished [their]746-they mid - day meal , and [he]144-gino wanted to go and sleep . Nothing would rouse [him]144-gino up , until at last [Lilia]100-lilia , getting more and more angry , said , " And [I]100-lilia 've got the money . "[100-lilia]

[He]144-gino looked horrified .

Now was the moment to assert [herself]100-lilia . [She]100-lilia made the statement again . [He]144-gino got up from [his]144-gino chair .

" And [you]144-gino 'd better mend [your]144-gino manners , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia continued , " for [you]144-gino 'd find it awkward if [I]100-lilia stopped drawing cheques . "[100-lilia]

[She]100-lilia was [no reader of character]747-no reader of character , but [she]100-lilia quickly became alarmed . As [she]100-lilia said to [Perfetta]150-perfetta afterwards , " None of [his]144-gino clothes seemed to fit - too big in one place , too small in another . "[100-lilia] [His]144-gino figure rather than [his]144-gino face altered , the shoulders falling forward till [his]144-gino coat wrinkled across the back and pulled away from [his]144-gino wrists . [He]144-gino seemed all arms . [He]144-gino edged round the table to where [she]100-lilia was sitting , and [she]100-lilia sprang away and held the chair between [them]748-them , too frightened to speak or to move . [He]144-gino looked at [her]100-lilia with round , expressionless eyes , and slowly stretched out [his]144-gino left hand .

[Perfetta]150-perfetta was heard coming up from [the kitchen]1828-the kitchen . It seemed to wake [him]144-gino up , and [he]144-gino turned away and went to [[his]144-gino room]750-his room without a word .

" What has happened ? "[100-lilia] cried [Lilia]100-lilia , nearly fainting . " [He]144-gino is ill - ill . "[100-lilia]

[Perfetta]150-perfetta looked suspicious when [she]150-perfetta heard the account . " What did [you]150-perfetta say to [him]144-gino ? "[100-lilia] [She]100-lilia crossed [herself]100-lilia .

" Hardly anything , "[100-lilia] said [Lilia]100-lilia and crossed [herself]100-lilia also . Thus did [the two women]751-the two women pay homage to [[their]751-the two women outraged male]752-their outraged male .

It was clear to [Lilia]100-lilia at last that [Gino]144-gino had married [her]100-lilia for money . But [he]144-gino had frightened [her]100-lilia too much to leave any place for contempt . [His]144-gino return was terrifying , for [he]144-gino was frightened too , imploring [her]100-lilia pardon , lying at [her]100-lilia feet , embracing [her]100-lilia , murmuring " It was not [I]144-gino , "[144-gino] striving to define things which [he]144-gino did not understand . [He]144-gino stopped in [the house]251-the house for three days , positively ill with physical collapse . But for all [his]144-gino suffering [he]144-gino had tamed [her]100-lilia , and [she]100-lilia never threatened to cut off supplies again .

Perhaps [he]144-gino kept [her]100-lilia even closer than convention demanded . But [he]144-gino was very young , and [he]144-gino could not bear it to be said of [him]144-gino that [he]144-gino did not know how to treat [a lady]1911-a lady - or to manage [a wife]755-a wife . And [his]144-gino own social position was uncertain . Even in [England]20-england [a dentist]1869-a dentist is [a troublesome creature , whom [careful people]758-careful people find difficult to class]757-a troublesome creature , whom careful people find difficult to class . [He]1869-a dentist hovers between the professions and the trades ; [he]1869-a dentist may be only a little lower than [the doctors]759-the doctors , or [he]1869-a dentist may be down among [the chemists]760-the chemists , or even beneath [them]760-the chemists . [The son of [the Italian dentist]762-the italian dentist]761-the son of the italian dentist felt this too . For [himself]144-gino nothing mattered ; [he]144-gino made [friends]713-friends with [the people [he]144-gino liked]764-the people he liked , for [he]144-gino was [that glorious invariable creature]765-that glorious invariable creature , [a man]1757-a man . But [[his]144-gino wife]533-his wife should visit nowhere rather than visit wrongly : seclusion was both decent and safe . The social ideals of North and [South]157-south had had [their]768-their brief contention , and this time [the South]632-the south had won .

It would have been well if [he]144-gino had been as strict over [his]144-gino own behaviour as [he]144-gino was over [hers]533-his wife . But the incongruity never occurred to [him]144-gino for a moment . [His]144-gino morality was that of [the average Latin]770-the average latin , and as [he]144-gino was suddenly placed in the position of [a gentleman]326-a gentleman , [he]144-gino did not see why [he]144-gino should not behave as such . Of course , had [Lilia]100-lilia been different - had [she]100-lilia asserted [herself]100-lilia and got a grip on [his]144-gino character - [he]144-gino might possibly - though not probably - have been made [a better husband]772-a better husband as well as [a better man]773-a better man , and at all events [he]144-gino could have adopted the attitude of [the Englishman]774-the englishman , whose standard is higher even when [his]144-gino practice is the same . But had [Lilia]100-lilia been different [she]100-lilia might not have married [him]144-gino .

The discovery of [his]144-gino infidelity - which [she]100-lilia made by accident - destroyed such remnants of self - satisfaction as [her]100-lilia life might yet possess . [She]100-lilia broke down utterly and sobbed and cried in [Perfetta]150-perfetta 's arms . [Perfetta]150-perfetta was kind and even sympathetic , but cautioned [her]100-lilia on no account to speak to [Gino]144-gino , who would be furious if [he]144-gino was suspected . And [Lilia]100-lilia agreed , partly because [she]100-lilia was afraid of [him]144-gino , partly because it was , after all , the best and most dignified thing to do . [She]100-lilia had given up everything for [him]144-gino - [[her]100-lilia daughter]264-her daughter , [[her]100-lilia relatives]776-her relatives , [[her]100-lilia friends]777-her friends , all the little comforts and luxuries of a civilized life - and even if [she]100-lilia had the courage to break away , there was [no one]1773-no one who would receive [her]100-lilia now . [The Herritons]147-the herritons had been almost malignant in [their]147-the herritons efforts against [her]100-lilia , and all [[her]100-lilia friends]777-her friends had one by one fallen off . So it was better to live on humbly , trying not to feel , endeavouring by a cheerful demeanour to put things right . " Perhaps , "[100-lilia] [she]100-lilia thought , " if [I]100-lilia have [a child]309-a child [he]309-a child will be different . [I]100-lilia know [he]309-a child wants [a son]2039-a son . "[100-lilia]

[Lilia]100-lilia had achieved pathos despite [herself]100-lilia , for there are some situations in which vulgarity counts no longer . Not [Cordelia]158-cordelia nor [Imogen]159-imogen more deserves [our]780-our tears .

[She]100-lilia [herself]100-lilia cried frequently , making [herself]100-lilia look plain and old , which distressed [[her]100-lilia husband]1962-her husband . [He]1962-her husband was particularly kind to [her]100-lilia when [he]1962-her husband hardly ever saw [her]100-lilia , and [she]100-lilia accepted [his]1962-her husband kindness without resentment , even with gratitude , so docile had [she]100-lilia become . [She]100-lilia did not hate [him]1962-her husband , even as [she]100-lilia had never loved [him]1962-her husband ; with [her]100-lilia it was only when [she]100-lilia was excited that the semblance of either passion arose . [People]1776-people said [she]100-lilia was headstrong , but really [her]100-lilia weak brain left [her]100-lilia cold .

Suffering , however , is more independent of temperament , and [the wisest of [women]490-women]783-the wisest of women could hardly have suffered more .

As for [Gino]144-gino , [he]144-gino was quite as boyish as ever , and carried [his]144-gino iniquities like a feather . A favourite speech of [his]144-gino was , " Ah , [one]289-one ought to marry ! [Spiridione]151-spiridione is wrong ; [I]144-gino must persuade [him]144-gino . Not till marriage does [one]289-one realize the pleasures and the possibilities of life . "[144-gino] So saying , [he]144-gino would take down [his]144-gino felt hat , strike it in the right place as infallibly as [a German]2004-a german strikes [his]144-gino in [the wrong place]786-the wrong place , and leave [her]100-lilia .

One evening , when [he]144-gino had gone out thus , [Lilia]100-lilia could stand it no longer . It was September . [Sawston]23-sawston would be just filling up after the summer holidays . [People]1776-people would be running in and out of [[each other]487-each other 's houses all along [the road]405-the road]789-each other 's houses all along the road . There were [bicycle gymkhanas]791-bicycle gymkhanas , and on the 30th [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton would be holding the annual bazaar in [[her]104-mrs. herriton garden]792-her garden for the C.M.S. It seemed impossible that such a free , happy life could exist . [She]100-lilia walked out on to [the loggia]607-the loggia . Moonlight and stars in a soft purple sky . The walls of [Monteriano]7-monteriano should be glorious on such a night as this . But [the house]251-the house faced away from [them]795-they .

[Perfetta]150-perfetta was banging in [the kitchen]1828-the kitchen , and the stairs down led past the kitchen door . But the stairs up to [the attic]1831-the attic - the stairs [no one]1773-no one ever used - opened out of [the living - room]651-the living - room , and by unlocking the door at the top one might slip out to [the square terrace above [the house]251-the house]800-the square terrace above the house , and thus for ten minutes walk in freedom and peace .

The key was in the pocket of [Gino]144-gino 's best suit - the English check - which [he]144-gino never wore . The stairs creaked and the key - hole screamed ; but [Perfetta]150-perfetta was growing deaf . The walls were beautiful , but as [they]795-they faced [west]802-west [they]795-they were in shadow . To see the light upon [them]795-they [she]150-perfetta must walk round [the town]461-the town a little , till [they]795-they were caught by the beams of the rising moon . [She]150-perfetta looked anxiously at [the house]251-the house , and started .

It was easy walking , for a little path ran all outside [the ramparts]712-the ramparts . [The few people [she]150-perfetta met]806-the few people she met wished [her]150-perfetta a civil good - night , taking [her]150-perfetta , in [her]150-perfetta hatless condition , for a peasant . The walls trended round towards the moon ; and presently [she]150-perfetta came into its light , and saw [all the rough towers]807-all the rough towers turn into pillars of silver and black , and the ramparts into [cliffs of pearl]808-cliffs of pearl . [She]150-perfetta had no great sense of beauty , but [she]150-perfetta was sentimental , and [she]150-perfetta began to cry ; for here , where a great cypress interrupted the monotony of the girdle of olives , [she]150-perfetta had sat with [Gino]144-gino one afternoon in [March]67-march , [her]150-perfetta head upon [his]144-gino shoulder , while [Caroline]107-miss abbott was looking at the view and sketching . Round the corner was the [Siena]31-siena gate , from which [the road to [England]20-england]809-the road to england started , and [she]150-perfetta could hear the rumble of the diligence which was going down to catch [the night train]810-the night train to [Empoli]57-empoli . The next moment it was upon [her]150-perfetta , for the highroad came towards [her]150-perfetta a little before it began its long zigzag down [the hill]811-the hill .

[The driver]426-the driver slackened , and called to [her]150-perfetta to get in . [He]426-the driver did not know who [she]150-perfetta was . [He]426-the driver hoped [she]150-perfetta might be coming to [the station]1792-the station .

" [Non vengo]154-non era simpatico ! "[150-perfetta] [she]150-perfetta cried .

[He]426-the driver wished [her]150-perfetta good - night , and turned [his]426-the driver horses down the corner . As the diligence came round [she]150-perfetta saw that [it]814-it was empty .

" [Vengo]160-vengo ... "[150-perfetta]

[Her]150-perfetta voice was tremulous , and did not carry . The horses swung off .

" [Vengo]160-vengo ! [Vengo]160-vengo ! "[150-perfetta]

[He]426-the driver had begun to sing , and heard nothing . [She]150-perfetta ran down [the road]405-the road screaming to [him]426-the driver to stop - that [she]150-perfetta was coming ; while the distance grew greater and the noise of [the diligence]816-the diligence increased . [The man]370-the man 's back was black and square against the moon , and if [he]370-the man would but turn for an instant [she]150-perfetta would be saved . [She]150-perfetta tried to cut off the corner of the zigzag , stumbling over the great clods of earth , large and hard as rocks , which lay between the eternal olives . [She]150-perfetta was too late ; for , just before [she]150-perfetta regained [the road]405-the road , the thing swept past [her]150-perfetta , thunderous , ploughing up choking clouds of moonlit dust .

[She]150-perfetta did not call any more , for [she]150-perfetta felt very ill , and fainted ; and when [she]150-perfetta revived [she]150-perfetta was lying in [the road]405-the road , with dust in [her]150-perfetta eyes , and dust in [her]150-perfetta mouth , and dust down [her]150-perfetta ears . There is something very terrible in dust at night - time .

" What shall [I]150-perfetta do ? "[150-perfetta] [she]150-perfetta moaned . " [He]144-gino will be so angry . "[150-perfetta]

And without further effort [she]150-perfetta slowly climbed back to captivity , shaking [her]150-perfetta garments as [she]150-perfetta went .

Ill luck pursued [her]150-perfetta to the end . It was one of the nights when [Gino]144-gino happened to come in . [He]144-gino was in [the kitchen]1828-the kitchen , swearing and smashing plates , while [Perfetta]150-perfetta , [her]150-perfetta apron over [her]150-perfetta head , was weeping violently . At the sight of [Lilia]100-lilia [he]144-gino turned upon [her]150-perfetta and poured forth a flood of miscellaneous abuse . [He]144-gino was far more angry but much less alarming than [he]144-gino had been that day when [he]144-gino edged after [her]150-perfetta round the table . And [Lilia]100-lilia gained more courage from [her]100-lilia bad conscience than [she]100-lilia ever had from [her]100-lilia good one , for as [he]144-gino spoke [she]150-perfetta was seized with indignation and feared [him]144-gino no longer , and saw [him]144-gino for [a cruel , worthless , hypocritical , dissolute upstart]821-a cruel , worthless , hypocritical , dissolute upstart , and spoke in return .

[Perfetta]150-perfetta screamed for [she]150-perfetta told [him]144-gino everything - all [she]150-perfetta knew and all [she]150-perfetta thought . [He]144-gino stood with open mouth , all the anger gone out of [him]144-gino , feeling ashamed , and [an utter fool]822-an utter fool . [He]144-gino was fairly and rightfully cornered . When had [a husband]823-a husband so given [himself]823-a husband away before ? [She]150-perfetta finished ; and [he]144-gino was dumb , for [she]150-perfetta had spoken truly . Then , alas ! the absurdity of [his]144-gino own position grew upon [him]144-gino , and [he]144-gino laughed - as [he]144-gino would have laughed at the same situation on the stage .

" [You]144-gino laugh ? "[100-lilia] stammered [Lilia]100-lilia .

" Ah ! "[144-gino] [he]144-gino cried , " who could help it ? [I]144-gino , who thought [you]100-lilia knew and saw nothing - [I]144-gino am tricked - [I]144-gino am conquered . [I]144-gino give in . Let [us]2042-us talk of it no more . "[144-gino]

[He]144-gino touched [her]100-lilia on the shoulder like [a good comrade]824-a good comrade , half amused and half penitent , and then , murmuring and smiling to [himself]144-gino , ran quietly out of [the room]306-the room .

[Perfetta]150-perfetta burst into congratulations . " What courage [you]144-gino have ! "[150-perfetta] [she]150-perfetta cried ; " and what good fortune ! [He]144-gino is angry no longer ! [He]144-gino has forgiven [you]144-gino ! "[150-perfetta]

[Neither Perfetta]150-perfetta , nor [Gino]144-gino , nor [Lilia]100-lilia [herself]100-lilia knew the true reason of all the misery that followed . To the end [he]144-gino thought that kindness and a little attention would be enough to set things straight . [[His]144-gino wife]533-his wife was [a very ordinary woman]827-a very ordinary woman , and why should [her]533-his wife ideas differ from [his]144-gino own ? [No one]1773-no one realized that more than [personalities were engaged]829-personalities were engaged ; that the struggle was national ; that generations of [ancestors]830-ancestors , good , bad , or indifferent , forbad [the Latin man]831-the latin man to be chivalrous to [the northern woman]832-the northern woman , [the northern woman]832-the northern woman to forgive [the Latin man]831-the latin man . All this might have been foreseen : [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton foresaw it from the first .

[Meanwhile Lilia]100-lilia prided [herself]100-lilia on [her]100-lilia high personal standard , and [Gino]144-gino simply wondered why [she]100-lilia did not come round . [He]144-gino hated discomfort and yearned for sympathy , but shrank from mentioning [his]144-gino difficulties in [the town]461-the town in case they were put down to [his]144-gino own incompetence . [Spiridione]151-spiridione was told , and replied in a philosophical but not very helpful letter . [[His]144-gino other great friend , whom [he]144-gino trusted more , was still serving in [Eritrea]68-eritrea or [some other desolate outpost]837-some other desolate outpost]836-his other great friend , whom he trusted more , was still serving in eritrea or some other desolate outpost . And , besides , what was the good of letters ? [Friends]713-friends can not travel through the post .

[Lilia]100-lilia , so similar to [[her]100-lilia husband]1962-her husband in many ways , yearned for comfort and sympathy too . The night [he]1962-her husband laughed at [her]100-lilia [she]100-lilia wildly took up paper and pen and wrote page after page , analysing [his]1962-her husband character , enumerating [his]1962-her husband iniquities , reporting whole conversations , tracing all the causes and the growth of [her]100-lilia misery . [She]100-lilia was beside [herself]100-lilia with passion , and though [she]100-lilia could hardly think or see , [she]100-lilia suddenly attained to magnificence and pathos which [a practised stylist]840-a practised stylist might have envied . It was written like a diary , and not till its conclusion did [she]100-lilia realize for whom it was meant .

" [Irma]103-irma , darling [Irma]103-irma , this letter is for [you]103-irma . [I]100-lilia almost forgot [I]100-lilia have [a daughter]1923-a daughter . It will make [you]103-irma unhappy , but [I]100-lilia want [you]103-irma to know everything , and [you]103-irma can not learn things too soon . God bless [you]103-irma , [[my]100-lilia dearest]2044-my dearest , and save [you]103-irma . God bless [[your]103-irma miserable mother]2045-your miserable mother . "[100-lilia]

[Fortunately Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton was in when the letter arrived . [She]100-lilia seized it and opened it in [[her]100-lilia bedroom]841-her bedroom . Another moment , and [Irma]103-irma 's placid childhood would have been destroyed for ever .

[Lilia]100-lilia received a brief note from [Harriet]102-harriet , again forbidding direct communication between [mother]1749-mother and [daughter]843-daughter , and concluding with formal condolences . It nearly drove [her]100-lilia mad .

" Gently ! gently ! "[1962-her husband] said [[her]100-lilia husband]1962-her husband . [They]845-they were sitting together on the loggia when the letter arrived . [He]1962-her husband often sat with [her]100-lilia now , watching [her]100-lilia for hours , puzzled and anxious , but not contrite .

" It 's nothing . "[100-lilia] [She]100-lilia went in and tore it up , and then began to write - a very short letter , whose gist was " Come and save [me]100-lilia . "[100-lilia]

It is not good to see [[your]846-you wife]847-your wife crying when [she]847-your wife writes - especially if [you]846-you are conscious that , on the whole , [your]846-you treatment of [her]847-your wife has been reasonable and kind . It is not good , when [you]846-you accidentally look over [her]847-your wife shoulder , to see that [she]847-your wife is writing to [a man]1757-a man . Nor should [she]847-your wife shake [her]847-your wife fist at [you]846-you when [she]847-your wife leaves [the room]306-the room , under the impression that [you]846-you are engaged in lighting a cigar and can not see [her]847-your wife .

[Lilia]100-lilia went to [the post]850-the post [herself]100-lilia . But in [Italy]8-italy so many things can be arranged . [The postman]851-the postman was [a friend of [Gino]144-gino 's]852-a friend of gino 's , and [Mr. Kingcroft]106-mr. kingcroft never got [his]106-mr. kingcroft letter .

So [she]100-lilia gave up hope , became ill , and all through the autumn lay in bed . [Gino]144-gino was distracted . [She]100-lilia knew why ; [he]144-gino wanted [a son]2039-a son . [He]144-gino could talk and think of nothing else . [His]144-gino one desire was to become [the father of [a man like [himself]144-gino]855-a man like himself]854-the father of a man like himself , and it held [him]144-gino with a grip [he]144-gino only partially understood , for it was the first great desire , the first great passion of [his]144-gino life . Falling in love was a mere physical triviality , like warm sun or cool water , beside this divine hope of immortality : " [I]144-gino continue . "[144-gino] [He]144-gino gave candles to [Santa Deodata]162-santa deodata , for [he]144-gino was always religious at a crisis , and sometimes [he]144-gino went to [her]162-santa deodata [himself]144-gino and prayed the crude uncouth demands of the simple . Impetuously [he]144-gino summoned all [[his]144-gino relatives]570-his relatives back to bear [him]144-gino company in [his]144-gino time of need , and [Lilia]100-lilia saw strange faces flitting past [her]100-lilia in [the darkened room]857-the darkened room .

" [My]144-gino love ! "[144-gino] [he]144-gino would say , " [[my]144-gino dearest]2044-my dearest [Lilia]100-lilia ! Be calm . [I]144-gino have never loved [any one]1758-any one but [you]100-lilia . "[144-gino]

[She]100-lilia , knowing everything , would only smile gently , too broken by suffering to make sarcastic repartees .

Before [the child]250-the child was born [he]144-gino gave [her]100-lilia a kiss , and said , " [I]144-gino have prayed all night for [a boy]597-a boy . "[144-gino]

Some strangely tender impulse moved [her]100-lilia , and [she]100-lilia said faintly , " [You]144-gino are [a boy]597-a boy [yourself]144-gino , [Gino]144-gino . "[100-lilia]

[He]144-gino answered , " Then [we]2050-we shall be [brothers]2051-brothers . "[144-gino]

[He]144-gino lay outside [the room]306-the room with [his]144-gino head against the door like a dog . When [they]860-they came to tell [him]144-gino the glad news [they]860-they found [him]144-gino half unconscious , and [his]144-gino face was wet with tears .

As for [Lilia]100-lilia , [some one]1989-some one said to [her]100-lilia , " It is [a beautiful boy]2052-a beautiful boy ! "[1989-some one] But [she]100-lilia had died in giving birth to [him]144-gino .

Chapter 5

At the time of [Lilia]100-lilia 's death [Philip Herriton]172-philip was just twenty - four years of age - indeed the news reached [Sawston]23-sawston on [his]172-philip birthday . [He]172-philip was [a tall , weakly - built young man , whose clothes had to be judiciously padded on the shoulders]862-a tall , weakly - built young man , whose clothes had to be judiciously padded on the shoulders in order to make [him]172-philip pass muster . [His]172-philip face was plain rather than not , and there was a curious mixture in it of good and bad . [He]172-philip had a fine forehead and a good large nose , and both observation and sympathy were in [his]172-philip eyes . But below the nose and eyes all was confusion , and [those people who believe that destiny resides in the mouth and chin]863-those people who believe that destiny resides in the mouth and chin shook [their]863-those people who believe that destiny resides in the mouth and chin heads when [they]863-those people who believe that destiny resides in the mouth and chin looked at [him]172-philip .

[Philip]172-philip [himself]172-philip , as [a boy]597-a boy , had been keenly conscious of these defects . Sometimes when [he]172-philip had been bullied or hustled about at [school]279-school [he]172-philip would retire to [[his]172-philip cubicle]866-his cubicle and examine [his]172-philip features in a looking - glass , and [he]172-philip would sigh and say , " It is a weak face . [I]172-philip shall never carve a place for [myself]172-philip in [the world]1768-the world . "[172-philip] But as years went on [he]172-philip became either less self - conscious or more self - satisfied . [The world]1768-the world , [he]172-philip found , made a niche for [him]172-philip as it did for every one . Decision of character might come later - or [he]172-philip might have it without knowing . At all events [he]172-philip had got a sense of beauty and a sense of humour , two most desirable gifts . The sense of beauty developed first . It caused [him]172-philip at the age of twenty to wear parti - coloured ties and a squashy hat , to be late for dinner on account of the sunset , and to catch art from [Burne - Jones]69-burne - jones to [Praxiteles]70-praxiteles . At twenty - two [he]172-philip went to [Italy]8-italy with [some cousins]868-some cousins , and there [he]172-philip absorbed into [one aesthetic whole olive - trees]869-one aesthetic whole olive - trees , blue sky , frescoes , [country inns]870-country inns , [saints]871-saints , [peasants]872-peasants , mosaics , statues , [beggars]873-beggars . [He]172-philip came back with the air of [a prophet who would either remodel [Sawston]23-sawston or reject it]874-a prophet who would either remodel sawston or reject it . All the energies and enthusiasms of a rather friendless life had passed into the championship of beauty .

In a short time it was over . Nothing had happened either in [Sawston]23-sawston or within [himself]172-philip . [He]172-philip had shocked [half - a - dozen people]875-half - a - dozen people , squabbled with [[his]172-philip sister]304-his sister , and bickered with [[his]172-philip mother]307-his mother . [He]172-philip concluded that nothing could happen , not knowing that human love and love of truth sometimes conquer where love of beauty fails .

A little disenchanted , a little tired , but aesthetically intact , [he]172-philip resumed [his]172-philip placid life , relying more and more on [his]172-philip second gift , the gift of humour . If [he]172-philip could not reform [the world]1768-the world , [he]172-philip could at all events laugh at it , thus attaining at least an intellectual superiority . Laughter , [he]172-philip read and believed , was a sign of good moral health , and [he]172-philip laughed on contentedly , till [Lilia]100-lilia 's marriage toppled contentment down for ever . [Italy]8-italy , [the land of beauty]879-the land of beauty , was ruined for [him]172-philip . [She]100-lilia had no power to change [men]1959-men and things who dwelt in [her]100-lilia . [She]100-lilia , too , could produce avarice , brutality , stupidity - and , what was worse , vulgarity . It was on [her]100-lilia soil and through [her]100-lilia influence that [a silly woman]881-a silly woman had married [a cad]1889-a cad . [He]172-philip hated [Gino]144-gino , [the betrayer of [his]172-philip life]883-the betrayer of his life 's ideal , and now that the sordid tragedy had come , it filled [him]172-philip with pangs , not of sympathy , but of final disillusion .

These events and conversations took place at Christmas - time . The New Life initiated by [them]901-we lasted some seven months . Then a little incident - a mere little vexatious incident - brought it to its close .

[Irma]103-irma collected picture post - cards , and [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton or [Harriet]102-harriet always glanced first at all that came , lest [the child]250-the child should get hold of something vulgar . On this occasion the subject seemed perfectly inoffensive - a lot of ruined factory chimneys - and [Harriet]102-harriet was about to hand it to [[her]102-harriet niece]357-her niece when [her]102-harriet eye was caught by the words on the margin . [She]102-harriet gave a shriek and flung the card into the grate . Of course no fire was alight in [July]168-july , and [Irma]103-irma only had to run and pick it out again .

" How dare [you]102-harriet ! "[906-her aunt] screamed [[her]102-harriet aunt]906-her aunt . " [[You]102-harriet wicked girl]2113-you wicked girl ! Give it here ! "[906-her aunt]

[Unfortunately Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton was out of [the room]306-the room . [Irma]103-irma , who was not in awe of [Harriet]102-harriet , danced round the table , reading as [she]103-irma did so , " View of [the superb city of [Monteriano]7-monteriano]2114-the superb city of monteriano - from [[your]102-harriet lital brother]2115-your lital brother . "[103-irma]

[Stupid Harriet]170-stupid harriet caught [her]103-irma , boxed [her]103-irma ears , and tore the post - card into fragments . [Irma]103-irma howled with pain , and began shouting indignantly , " Who is [[my]103-irma little brother]2116-my little brother ? Who is [my]103-irma - "[103-irma]

[Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton swept into [the room]306-the room , saying , " Come with [me]104-mrs. herriton , [dear]1744-dear , and [I]104-mrs. herriton will tell [you]1744-dear . Now it is time for [you]1744-dear to know . "[104-mrs. herriton]

[Irma]103-irma returned from the interview sobbing , though , as a matter of fact , [she]103-irma had learnt very little . But that little took hold of [her]103-irma imagination . [She]104-mrs. herriton had promised secrecy - [she]104-mrs. herriton knew not why . [He]949-he was sure that [she]104-mrs. herriton was not impulsive , but did not dare to say so . [Her]104-mrs. herriton ability frightened [him]949-he . And though [she]104-mrs. herriton was frightening [him]949-he , [she]104-mrs. herriton did not inspire [him]949-he with reverence . [Her]104-mrs. herriton life , [he]949-he saw , was without meaning . To what purpose was [her]104-mrs. herriton diplomacy , [her]104-mrs. herriton insincerity , [her]104-mrs. herriton continued repression of vigour ? Did [they]951-they make [any one]1758-any one better or happier ? Did [they]951-they even bring happiness to [herself]104-mrs. herriton ? [Harriet]102-harriet with [her]102-harriet gloomy peevish creed , [Lilia]100-lilia with [her]100-lilia clutches after pleasure , were after all more divine than this well - ordered , active , useless machine .

Now that [[his]949-he mother]307-his mother had wounded [his]949-he vanity [he]949-he could criticize [her]104-mrs. herriton thus . But [he]949-he could not rebel . To the end of [his]949-he days [he]949-he could probably go on doing what [she]104-mrs. herriton wanted . [He]949-he watched with a cold interest the duel between [her]104-mrs. herriton and [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott . [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton 's policy only appeared gradually . "[107-miss abbott]

[Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott was equally civil , but not to be appeased by good intentions . [The child]250-the child 's welfare was a sacred duty to [her]107-miss abbott , not a matter of pride or even of sentiment . To [her]107-miss abbott imagination [Monteriano]7-monteriano had become [a magic city of vice]959-a magic city of vice , beneath whose towers [no person]960-no person could grow up happy or pure . As soon as it was inevitable , [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton wrote a letter for [Waters]163-waters and [Adamson]164-adamson to send to [Gino]144-gino - the oddest letter ; [Philip]172-philip saw a copy of it afterwards . " What do [you]255-her son think of it ? "[107-miss abbott] [she]107-miss abbott asked [[her]107-miss abbott son]255-her son . " It would not do to let [him]144-gino know that [we]2177-we are anxious for it . "[107-miss abbott]

" [Dear]1744-dear , [you]1744-dear 're shockingly cynical . "[107-miss abbott] After a pause [she]107-miss abbott added , " How would the sum work out ? "[107-miss abbott]

" [I]968-i do n't know , [I]968-i 'm sure . But if [you]1744-dear wanted to ensure [the baby]2072-the baby being posted by return , [you]1744-dear should have sent a little sum to [HIM]144-gino . Oh , [I]968-i 'm not cynical - at least [I]968-i only go by what [I]968-i know of [him]144-gino . But [I]968-i am weary of the whole show . Weary of [Italy]8-italy . Weary , weary , weary . [Sawston]23-sawston 's a kind , pitiful place , is n't it ? [I]968-i will go walk in [it]23-sawston and seek comfort . "[968-i]

[He]968-i smiled as [he]968-i spoke , for the sake of not appearing serious . When [he]968-i had left [her]107-miss abbott [she]107-miss abbott began to smile also .

It was to [the Abbotts]174-the abbotts ' that [he]968-i walked . [Mr. Abbott]128-mr. abbott offered [him]968-i tea , and [Caroline]107-miss abbott , who was keeping up [her]107-miss abbott Italian in [the next room]969-the next room , came in to pour it out . [He]968-i told [them]970-them that [[his]968-i mother]307-his mother had written to [Signor Carella]131-signor carella , and [they]970-them both uttered fervent wishes for [her]307-his mother success .

" Very fine of [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton , very fine indeed , "[128-mr. abbott] said [Mr. Abbott]128-mr. abbott , who , like [every one else]972-every one else , knew nothing of [[his]128-mr. abbott daughter]973-his daughter 's exasperating behaviour . " [I]128-mr. abbott 'm afraid it will mean a lot of expense . [She]104-mrs. herriton will get nothing out of [Italy]8-italy without paying . "[128-mr. abbott]

" There are sure to be incidental expenses , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip cautiously . Then [he]172-philip turned to [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott and said , " Do [you]107-miss abbott suppose [we]970-them shall have difficulty with [the man]370-the man ? "[172-philip]

" It depends , "[107-miss abbott] [she]107-miss abbott replied , with equal caution .

" From what [you]172-philip saw of [him]370-the man , should [you]172-philip conclude that [he]370-the man would make [an affectionate parent]2183-an affectionate parent ? "[128-mr. abbott]

" [I]172-philip do n't go by what [I]172-philip saw of [him]370-the man , but by what [I]172-philip know of [him]370-the man . "[172-philip]

" Well , what do [you]172-philip conclude from that ? "[128-mr. abbott]

" That [he]370-the man is [a thoroughly wicked man]2184-a thoroughly wicked man . "[172-philip]

" [Yet thoroughly wicked men]2185-yet thoroughly wicked men have loved [[their]2185-yet thoroughly wicked men children]2186-their children . Look at [Rodrigo Borgia]175-rodrigo borgia , for example . "[128-mr. abbott]

" [I]172-philip have also seen examples of that in [[my]172-philip district]2187-my district . "[172-philip]

With this remark [the admirable young woman]974-the admirable young woman rose , and returned to keep up [her]974-the admirable young woman Italian . [She]974-the admirable young woman puzzled [Philip]172-philip extremely . [He]172-philip could understand enthusiasm , but [she]974-the admirable young woman did not seem the least enthusiastic . [He]172-philip could understand pure cussedness , but it did not seem to be that either . Apparently [she]974-the admirable young woman was deriving neither amusement nor profit from the struggle . Why , then , had [she]974-the admirable young woman undertaken it ? Perhaps [she]974-the admirable young woman was not sincere . Perhaps , on the whole , that was most likely . [She]974-the admirable young woman must be professing one thing and aiming at another . What the other thing could be [he]172-philip did not stop to consider . Insincerity was becoming [his]172-philip stock explanation for anything unfamiliar , whether that thing was a kindly action or a high ideal .

" [She]974-the admirable young woman fences well , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip said to [[his]172-philip mother]307-his mother afterwards .

" What had [you]172-philip to fence about ? "[307-his mother] [she]307-his mother said suavely . [[Her]307-his mother son]255-her son might know [her]307-his mother tactics , but [she]307-his mother refused to admit that [he]172-philip knew . [She]307-his mother still pretended to [him]172-philip that [the baby]2072-the baby was the one thing [she]307-his mother wanted , and had always wanted , and that [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott was [[her]307-his mother valued ally]978-her valued ally .

And when , next week , the reply came from [Italy]8-italy , [she]307-his mother showed [him]172-philip no face of triumph . " Read the letters , "[307-his mother] [she]307-his mother said . " [We]2188-we have failed . "[307-his mother]

[Gino]144-gino wrote in [his]144-gino own language , but [the solicitors]596-the solicitors had sent a laborious English translation , where " Preghiatissima Signora "[307-his mother] was rendered as " Most Praiseworthy Madam , "[307-his mother] and every delicate compliment and superlative - superlatives are delicate in Italian - would have felled an ox . For a moment [Philip]172-philip forgot the matter in the manner ; this grotesque memorial of [the land [he]172-philip had loved]980-the land he had loved moved [him]172-philip almost to tears . [He]172-philip knew the originals of these lumbering phrases ; [he]172-philip also had sent ' sincere auguries " ; [he]172-philip also had addressed letters - who writes at [home]334-home ? - from [the Caffe Garibaldi]141-caffe garibaldi . "[172-philip] [I]0-i did n't know [I]0-i was still such [an ass]981-an ass , " [he]172-philip thought . "[0-i] Why ca n't [I]0-i realize that it 's merely tricks of expression ? [A bounder]982-a bounder 's [a bounder]982-a bounder , whether [he]982-a bounder lives in [Sawston]23-sawston or [Monteriano]7-monteriano . "[982-a bounder]

" Is n't it disheartening ? "[307-his mother] said [[his]172-philip mother]307-his mother .

[He]172-philip then read that [Gino]144-gino could not accept the generous offer . [His]144-gino paternal heart would not permit [him]144-gino to abandon this symbol of [[his]144-gino deplored spouse]985-his deplored spouse . As for the picture post - cards , it displeased [him]144-gino greatly that [they]986-they had been obnoxious . [He]144-gino would send no more . " The sum works out against [us]2190-us , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip . " Or perhaps [he]144-gino is putting up the price . "[172-philip]

" No , "[104-mrs. herriton] said [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton decidedly . " It is not that . For some perverse reason [he]144-gino will not part with [the child]250-the child . [I]104-mrs. herriton must go and tell [poor Caroline]107-miss abbott . [She]107-miss abbott will be equally distressed . "[104-mrs. herriton]

[She]104-mrs. herriton returned from the visit in the most extraordinary condition . [Her]104-mrs. herriton face was red , [she]104-mrs. herriton panted for breath , there were dark circles round [her]104-mrs. herriton eyes .

" Go where ? Do sit down . What 's happened ? "[987-i] This outburst of violence from [[his]987-i elegant ladylike mother]988-his elegant ladylike mother pained [him]987-i dreadfully . [He]987-i had not known that it was in [her]988-his elegant ladylike mother .

" [She]2193-that beastly woman wo n't accept - wo n't accept the letter as final . [You]172-philip must go to [Monteriano]7-monteriano ! "[104-mrs. herriton]

" [I]987-i wo n't ! "[987-i] [he]987-i shouted back . " [I]987-i 've been and [I]987-i 've failed . [I]987-i 'll never see [the place]280-the place again . [I]987-i hate [Italy]8-italy . "[987-i]

" [Abbott]107-miss abbott ? "[987-i]

" Yes . Going alone ; would start this evening . [I]104-mrs. herriton offered to write ; [she]2193-that beastly woman said it was ' too late ! ' Too late ! [He]989-he seemed to be inspired . " Then let [her]2203-that woman go ! Let [her]2203-that woman mess with [Italy]8-italy by [herself]2203-that woman . [She]2203-that woman 'll come to grief somehow . [Italy]8-italy 's too dangerous , too - "[989-he]
