[He]172-philip begged [him]172-philip to give [his]172-philip love to [Irma]103-irma . [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton - should [he]172-philip send [her]104-mrs. herriton [his]172-philip sympathetic regards ? No ; perhaps that would hardly do .

So [the two young men]1501-the two young men parted with a good deal of genuine affection . For the barrier of language is sometimes a blessed barrier , which only lets pass what is good . Or - to put the thing less cynically - [we]1502-we may be better in new clean words , which have never been tainted by [our]1502-we pettiness or vice . [Philip]172-philip , at all events , lived more graciously in Italian , the very phrases of which entice [one]289-one to be happy and kind . It was horrible to think of the English of [Harriet]102-harriet , whose every word would be as hard , as distinct , and as unfinished as a lump of coal .

[Harriet]102-harriet , however , talked little . [She]102-harriet had seen enough to know that [[her]102-harriet brother]1014-her brother had failed again , and with unwonted dignity [she]102-harriet accepted the situation . [She]102-harriet did [her]102-harriet packing , [she]102-harriet wrote up [her]102-harriet diary , [she]102-harriet made a brown paper cover for the new Baedeker . [Philip]172-philip , finding [her]102-harriet so amenable , tried to discuss [their]1501-the two young men future plans . But [she]102-harriet only said that [they]1501-the two young men would sleep in [Florence]24-florence , and told [him]172-philip to telegraph for [rooms]2267-rooms . [They]1501-the two young men had supper alone . [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott did not come down . [The landlady]476-the landlady told [them]1501-the two young men that [Signor Carella]131-signor carella had called on [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott to say good - bye , but [she]102-harriet , though in , had not been able to see [him]172-philip . [She]102-harriet also told [them]1501-the two young men that it had begun to rain . [Harriet]102-harriet sighed , but indicated to [[her]102-harriet brother]1014-her brother that [he]172-philip was not responsible .

[The carriages]1508-the carriages came round at a quarter past eight . It was not raining much , but the night was extraordinarily dark , and [one of [the drivers]1510-the drivers]1509-one of the drivers wanted to go slowly to [the station]1792-the station . [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott came down and said that [she]107-miss abbott was ready , and would start at once .

" Yes , do , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip , who was standing in [the hall]377-the hall . " Now that [we]2516-we have quarrelled [we]2516-we scarcely want to travel in procession all the way down [the hill]811-the hill . Well , good - bye ; it 's all over at last ; another scene in [my]172-philip pageant has shifted . "[172-philip]

" Good - bye ; it 's been a great pleasure to see [you]102-harriet . [I]102-harriet hope that wo n't shift , at all events . "[102-harriet] [She]102-harriet gripped [his]172-philip hand .

" [You]102-harriet sound despondent , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip said , laughing . " Do n't forget that [you]102-harriet return victorious . "[172-philip]

" [I]102-harriet suppose [I]102-harriet do , "[102-harriet] [she]102-harriet replied , more despondently than ever , and got into [the carriage]244-the carriage . [He]172-philip concluded that [she]102-harriet was thinking of [her]102-harriet reception at [Sawston]23-sawston , whither [her]102-harriet fame would doubtless precede [her]102-harriet . Whatever would [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton do ? [She]102-harriet could make things quite unpleasant when [she]102-harriet thought it right . [She]102-harriet might think it right to be silent , but then there was [Harriet]102-harriet . Who would bridle [Harriet]102-harriet 's tongue ? Between the two of [them]1514-them [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott was bound to have a bad time . [Her]107-miss abbott reputation , both for consistency and for moral enthusiasm , would be lost for ever .

" It 's hard luck on [her]107-miss abbott , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip thought . " [She]107-miss abbott is [a good person]2518-a good person . [I]172-philip must do for [her]107-miss abbott anything [I]172-philip can . "[172-philip] [Their]1514-them intimacy had been very rapid , but [he]172-philip too hoped that it would not shift . [He]172-philip believed that [he]172-philip understood [her]107-miss abbott , and that [she]107-miss abbott , by now , had seen the worst of [him]172-philip . What if after a long time - if after all - [he]172-philip flushed like [a boy]597-a boy as [he]172-philip looked after [[her]107-miss abbott carriage]1516-her carriage .

[He]172-philip went into [the dining - room]249-the dining - room to look for [Harriet]102-harriet . [Harriet]102-harriet was not to be found . [[Her]102-harriet bedroom]841-her bedroom , too , was empty . All that was left of [her]102-harriet was the purple prayer - book which lay open on the bed . [Philip]172-philip took it up aimlessly , and saw - " Blessed be [the Lord [my]172-philip God who teacheth [my]172-philip hands to war and [my]172-philip fingers to fight]112-god . "[172-philip] [He]172-philip put the book in [his]172-philip pocket , and began to brood over more profitable themes .

[Santa Deodata]162-santa deodata gave out half past eight . All the luggage was on , and still [Harriet]102-harriet had not appeared . " Depend upon it , "[476-the landlady] said [the landlady]476-the landlady , ' [she]476-the landlady has gone to [Signor Carella]131-signor carella 's to say good - bye to [[her]476-the landlady little nephew]1520-her little nephew . " [Philip]172-philip did not think it likely . [They]2519-they shouted all over [the house]251-the house and still there was no [Harriet]102-harriet . [He]172-philip began to be uneasy . [He]172-philip was helpless without [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott ; [her]107-miss abbott grave , kind face had cheered [him]172-philip wonderfully , even when it looked displeased . [Monteriano]7-monteriano was sad without [her]107-miss abbott ; the rain was thickening ; the scraps of [Donizetti]190-the master donizetti floated tunelessly out of [the wineshops]2521-the wineshops , and of [the great tower]2522-the great tower opposite [he]172-philip could only see the base , fresh papered with the advertisements of quacks .[476-the landlady]

[A man]1757-a man came up [the street]623-the street with a note . [Philip]172-philip read , " Start at once . Pick [me]1757-a man up outside the gate . Pay [the bearer]2523-the bearer . H. H. "[1757-a man]

" Did [the lady]1752-the lady give [you]370-the man this note ? "[172-philip] [he]172-philip cried .

[The man]370-the man was unintelligible .

" Speak up ! "[172-philip] exclaimed [Philip]172-philip . " Who gave [it]2525-it [you]370-the man - and where ? "[172-philip]

Nothing but horrible sighings and bubblings came out of [the man]370-the man .

" Be patient with [him]1528-the messenger , "[426-the driver] said [the driver]426-the driver , turning round on the box . " It is [the poor idiot]2526-the poor idiot . "[426-the driver] And [the landlady]476-the landlady came out of [the hotel]1775-the hotel and echoed " [The poor idiot]2526-the poor idiot . [He]1528-the messenger can not speak . [He]1528-the messenger takes messages for [us]2528-us all . "[476-the landlady]

[Philip]172-philip then saw that [the messenger]1528-the messenger was a ghastly creature , quite bald , with trickling eyes and grey twitching nose . In [another country]1529-another country [he]1528-the messenger would have been shut up ; [here]1844-here [he]1528-the messenger was accepted as [a public institution]1531-a public institution , and part of [Nature]202-nature 's scheme .

" Ugh ! "[774-the englishman] shuddered [the Englishman]774-the englishman . " [Signora padrona]181-signora padrona , find out from [him]1528-the messenger ; this note is from [[my]774-the englishman sister]2515-my sister . What does it mean ? Where did [he]1528-the messenger see [her]2515-my sister ? "[774-the englishman]

" It is no good , "[476-the landlady] said [the landlady]476-the landlady . " [He]1528-the messenger understands everything but [he]1528-the messenger can explain nothing . "[476-the landlady]

" [He]1528-the messenger has visions of [the saints]2530-the saints , "[1534-the man who drove the cab] said [the man who drove [the cab]1535-the cab]1534-the man who drove the cab .

" But [[my]476-the landlady sister]2515-my sister - where has [she]2515-my sister gone ? How has [she]2515-my sister met [him]1528-the messenger ? "[476-the landlady]

" [She]2515-my sister has gone for a walk , "[476-the landlady] asserted [the landlady]476-the landlady . It was a nasty evening , but [she]476-the landlady was beginning to understand the English . " [She]2515-my sister has gone for a walk - perhaps to wish good - bye to [[her]2515-my sister little nephew]1520-her little nephew . Preferring to come back another way , [she]2515-my sister has sent [you]1534-the man who drove the cab this note by [the poor idiot]2526-the poor idiot and is waiting for [you]1534-the man who drove the cab outside the Siena gate . [Many of [[my]476-the landlady guests]2535-my guests]2534-many of my guests do this . "[476-the landlady]

There was nothing to do but to obey the message . [He]1534-the man who drove the cab shook hands with [the landlady]476-the landlady , gave [the messenger]1528-the messenger a nickel piece , and drove away . After a dozen yards [the carriage]244-the carriage stopped . [The poor idiot]2526-the poor idiot was running and whimpering behind .

" Go on , "[172-philip] cried [Philip]172-philip . " [I]172-philip have paid [him]2526-the poor idiot plenty . "[172-philip]

A horrible hand pushed [three soldi]1541-three soldi into [his]172-philip lap . It was part of [the idiot]1542-the idiot 's malady only to receive what was just for [his]172-philip services . This was the change out of the nickel piece .

" Go on ! "[172-philip] shouted [Philip]172-philip , and flung the money into [the road]405-the road . [He]172-philip was frightened at the episode ; the whole of life had become unreal . It was a relief to be out of [the Siena gate]1170-the siena gate . [They]1545-they drew up for a moment on [the terrace]1546-the terrace . But there was no sign of [Harriet]102-harriet . [The driver]426-the driver called to [the Dogana men]480-the dogana men . But [they]480-the dogana men had seen [no English lady]1549-no english lady pass .

" What am [I]426-the driver to do ? "[426-the driver] [he]426-the driver cried ; " it is not like [the lady]1752-the lady to be late . [We]1545-they shall miss [the train]237-the train . "[426-the driver]

" Let [us]1545-they drive slowly , "[426-the driver] said [the driver]426-the driver , " and [you]426-the driver shall call [her]102-harriet by name as [we]1545-they go . "[426-the driver]

So [they]1545-they started down into the night , [Philip]172-philip calling " [Harriet]102-harriet ! [Harriet]102-harriet ! [Harriet]102-harriet ! "[172-philip] And there [she]102-harriet was , waiting for [them]1545-they in the wet , at the first turn of the zigzag .

" [Harriet]102-harriet , why do n't [you]102-harriet answer ? "[102-harriet]

" [I]102-harriet heard [you]172-philip coming , "[102-harriet] said [she]102-harriet , and got quickly in . Not till then did [he]172-philip see that [she]102-harriet carried a bundle .

" What 's that ? "[102-harriet]

" [Hush]211-hush - "[172-philip]

" Whatever is that ? "[102-harriet]

" Hush - sleeping . "[172-philip]

[Harriet]102-harriet had succeeded where [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott and [Philip]172-philip had failed . It was [the baby]2072-the baby .

[She]102-harriet would not let [him]172-philip talk . [The baby]2072-the baby , [she]102-harriet repeated , was asleep , and [she]102-harriet put up an umbrella to shield it and [her]102-harriet from the rain . [He]172-philip should hear all later , so [he]172-philip had to conjecture the course of the wonderful interview - an interview between [the South pole]1553-the south pole and [the North]96-the north . It was quite easy to conjecture : [Gino]144-gino crumpling up suddenly before the intense conviction of [Harriet]102-harriet ; being told , perhaps , to [his]144-gino face that [he]144-gino was [a villain]1554-a villain ; yielding [[his]144-gino only son]1555-his only son perhaps for money , perhaps for nothing . " [Poor Gino]144-gino , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip thought . " [He]144-gino 's no greater than [I]172-philip am , after all . "[172-philip]

Then [he]172-philip thought of [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , whose carriage must be descending the darkness some mile or two below [them]1556-we , and [his]172-philip easy self - accusation failed . [She]107-miss abbott , too , had conviction ; [he]172-philip had felt its force ; [he]172-philip would feel it again when [she]107-miss abbott knew this day 's sombre and unexpected close .

" [You]107-miss abbott have been pretty secret , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip said ; " [you]107-miss abbott might tell [me]172-philip a little now . What do [we]1556-we pay for [him]2072-the baby ? All [we]1556-we 've got ? "[172-philip]

" Hush ! "[102-harriet] answered [Harriet]102-harriet , and dandled the bundle laboriously , like [some bony prophetess]1557-some bony prophetess - [Judith]212-judith , or [Deborah]213-deborah , or [Jael]214-jael . [He]172-philip had last seen [the baby]2072-the baby sprawling on the knees of [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , shining and naked , with twenty miles of view behind [him]2072-the baby , and [[his]2072-the baby father]1863-his father kneeling by [his]2072-the baby feet . And that remembrance , together with [Harriet]102-harriet , and the darkness , and [the poor idiot]2526-the poor idiot , and the silent rain , filled [him]172-philip with sorrow and with the expectation of sorrow to come .

[Monteriano]7-monteriano had long disappeared , and [he]172-philip could see nothing but the occasional wet stem of an olive , which [their]1561-they lamp illumined as [they]1561-they passed it . [They]1561-they travelled quickly , for [this driver]1562-this driver did not care how fast [he]172-philip went to [the station]1792-the station , and would dash down [each incline]1564-each incline and scuttle perilously round the curves .

" Look here , [Harriet]102-harriet , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip said at last , " [I]172-philip feel bad ; [I]172-philip want to see [the baby]2072-the baby . "[172-philip]

" Hush ! "[102-harriet]

" [I]172-philip do n't mind if [I]172-philip do wake [him]2072-the baby up . [I]172-philip want to see [him]2072-the baby . [I]172-philip 've as much right in [him]2072-the baby as [you]102-harriet . "[172-philip]

[Harriet]102-harriet gave in . But it was too dark for [him]172-philip to see [the child]250-the child 's face . " Wait a minute , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip whispered , and before [she]102-harriet could stop [him]172-philip [he]172-philip had lit a match under the shelter of [her]102-harriet umbrella . " But [he]2072-the baby 's awake ! "[172-philip] [he]172-philip exclaimed . The match went out .

" Good ickle quiet boysey , then . "[172-philip]

[Philip]172-philip winced . " [His]2072-the baby face , do [you]102-harriet know , struck [me]172-philip as all wrong . "[172-philip]

" All wrong ? "[172-philip]

" All puckered queerly . "[172-philip]

" Of course - with the shadows - [you]102-harriet could n't see [him]2072-the baby . "[172-philip]

" Well , hold [him]2072-the baby up again . "[102-harriet] [She]102-harriet did so . [He]172-philip lit another match . It went out quickly , but not before [he]172-philip had seen that [the baby]2072-the baby was crying .

" Nonsense , "[102-harriet] said [Harriet]102-harriet sharply . " [We]2539-we should hear [him]2072-the baby if [he]2072-the baby cried . "[102-harriet]

" No , [he]2072-the baby 's crying hard ; [I]172-philip thought so before , and [I]172-philip 'm certain now . "[172-philip]

[Harriet]102-harriet touched [the child]250-the child 's face . It was bathed in tears . " Oh , the night air , [I]102-harriet suppose , "[102-harriet] [she]102-harriet said , " or perhaps the wet of the rain . "[102-harriet]

" [I]102-harriet say , [you]102-harriet have n't hurt [it]250-the child , or held [it]250-the child the wrong way , or anything ; it is too uncanny - crying and no noise . Why did n't [you]102-harriet get [Perfetta]150-perfetta to carry [it]250-the child to [the hotel]1775-the hotel instead of muddling with [the messenger]1528-the messenger ? It 's a marvel [he]1568-he understood about the note . "[102-harriet]

" Oh , [he]1568-he understands . "[102-harriet] And [he]1568-he could feel [her]102-harriet shudder . " [He]1568-he tried to carry [the baby]2072-the baby - "[102-harriet]

" But why not [Gino]144-gino or [Perfetta]150-perfetta ? "[102-harriet]

" [Philip]172-philip , do n't talk . Must [I]102-harriet say it again ? Do n't talk . [The baby]2072-the baby wants to sleep . "[102-harriet] [She]102-harriet crooned harshly as [they]1569-they descended , and now and then [she]102-harriet wiped up the tears which welled inexhaustibly from the little eyes . [Philip]172-philip looked away , winking at times [himself]172-philip . It was as if [they]1569-they were travelling with [the whole world]1570-the whole world 's sorrow , as if all the mystery , all the persistency of woe were gathered to a single fount . [The roads]1571-the roads were now coated with mud , and [the carriage]244-the carriage went more quietly but not less swiftly , sliding by long zigzags into the night . [He]172-philip knew the landmarks pretty well : here was [the crossroad to [Poggibonsi]41-poggibonsi]1573-the crossroad to poggibonsi ; and the last view of [Monteriano]7-monteriano , if [they]1569-they had light , would be from here . Soon [they]1569-they ought to come to [that little wood]1574-that little wood where violets were so plentiful in spring . [He]172-philip wished the weather had not changed ; it was not cold , but the air was extraordinarily damp . It could not be good for [the child]250-the child .

" [I]172-philip suppose [he]250-the child breathes , and all that sort of thing ? "[172-philip] [he]172-philip said .

" Of course , "[102-harriet] said [Harriet]102-harriet , in an angry whisper . " [You]172-philip 've started [him]250-the child again . [I]102-harriet 'm certain [he]250-the child was asleep . [I]102-harriet do wish [you]172-philip would n't talk ; it makes [me]102-harriet so nervous . "[102-harriet]

" [I]1576-i 'm nervous too . [I]1576-i wish [he]250-the child 'd scream . It 's too uncanny . [Poor Gino]144-gino ! [I]1576-i 'm terribly sorry for [Gino]144-gino . "[1576-i]

" Are [you]172-philip ? "[102-harriet]

" Because [he]250-the child 's weak - like most of [us]2544-us . [He]250-the child does n't know what [he]250-the child wants . [He]250-the child does n't grip on to life . But [I]1576-i like [that man]2221-that man , and [I]1576-i 'm sorry for [him]250-the child . "[1576-i]

Naturally enough [she]1576-i made no answer .

" [You]172-philip despise [him]250-the child , [Harriet]102-harriet , and [you]172-philip despise [me]1576-i . But [you]172-philip do [us]2544-us no good by it . [We]2544-us fools want [some one]1989-some one to set [us]2544-us on [our]2544-us feet . Suppose [a really decent woman]2547-a really decent woman had set up [Gino]144-gino - [I]1576-i believe [Caroline Abbott]107-miss abbott might have done it - might n't [he]250-the child have been [another man]2548-another man ? "[1576-i]

" [Philip]172-philip , "[1576-i] [she]1576-i interrupted , with an attempt at nonchalance , " do [you]172-philip happen to have those matches handy ? [We]2544-us might as well look at [the baby]2072-the baby again if [you]172-philip have . "[1576-i]

The first match blew out immediately . So did [the second]1577-the second . [He]1576-i suggested that [they]1578-they should stop [the carriage]244-the carriage and borrow the lamp from [the driver]426-the driver .

" Oh , [I]1576-i do n't want all that bother . Try again . "[1576-i]

[They]1578-they entered [the little wood]1581-the little wood as [he]1576-i tried to strike the third match . At last it caught . [Harriet]102-harriet poised the umbrella rightly , and for a full quarter minute [they]1578-they contemplated the face that trembled in the light of the trembling flame . Then there was a shout and a crash . [They]1578-they were lying in [the mud]1582-the mud in darkness . [The carriage]244-the carriage had overturned .

[Philip]172-philip was a good deal hurt . [He]172-philip sat up and rocked [himself]172-philip to and fro , holding [his]172-philip arm . [He]172-philip could just make out the outline of [the carriage]244-the carriage above [him]172-philip , and the outlines of [the carriage]244-the carriage cushions and of [their]1578-they luggage upon [the grey road]1586-the grey road . The accident had taken place in the wood , where it was even darker than in the open .

" Are [you]102-harriet all right ? "[172-philip] [he]172-philip managed to say . [Harriet]102-harriet was screaming , the horse was kicking , [the driver]426-the driver was cursing [some other man]1588-some other man .

[Harriet]102-harriet 's screams became coherent . " [The baby]2072-the baby - [the baby]2072-the baby - it slipped - it 's gone from [my]102-harriet arms - [I]102-harriet stole it ! "[102-harriet]

" [God]112-god help [me]172-philip ! "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip . A cold circle came round [his]172-philip mouth , and , [he]172-philip fainted .

When [he]172-philip recovered it was still the same confusion . The horse was kicking , [the baby]2072-the baby had not been found , and [Harriet]102-harriet still screamed like [a maniac]1590-a maniac , " [I]102-harriet stole it ! [I]102-harriet stole it ! [I]102-harriet stole it ! It slipped out of [my]102-harriet arms ! "[102-harriet]

" Keep still ! "[172-philip] [he]172-philip commanded [the driver]426-the driver . " Let [no one]1773-no one move . [We]1592-we may tread on it . Keep still . "[172-philip]

For a moment [they]1592-we all obeyed [him]172-philip . [He]172-philip began to crawl through the mud , touching first this , then that , grasping the cushions by mistake , listening for the faintest whisper that might guide [him]172-philip . [He]172-philip tried to light a match , holding the box in [his]172-philip teeth and striking at it with the uninjured hand . At last [he]172-philip succeeded , and the light fell upon the bundle which [he]172-philip was seeking .

It had rolled off [the road]405-the road into the wood a little way , and had fallen across a great rut . So tiny it was that had [it]2072-the baby fallen lengthways it would have disappeared , and [he]172-philip might never have found it .

" [I]1594-i stole it ! [I]1594-i and [the idiot]1542-the idiot - [no one]1773-no one was there . "[1594-i] [She]1594-i burst out laughing .

[He]172-philip sat down and laid it on [his]172-philip knee . Then [he]172-philip tried to cleanse the face from the mud and the rain and the tears . [His]172-philip arm , [he]172-philip supposed , was broken , but [he]172-philip could still move it a little , and for the moment [he]172-philip forgot all pain . [He]172-philip was listening - not for a cry , but for the tick of a heart or the slightest tremor of breath .

" Where are [you]172-philip ? "[107-miss abbott] called a voice . It was [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , against [whose carriage [they]1596-they had collided]1595-whose carriage they had collided . [She]107-miss abbott had relit one of the lamps , and was picking [her]107-miss abbott way towards [him]172-philip .

" Silence ! "[172-philip] [he]172-philip called again , and again [they]1596-they obeyed . [He]172-philip shook the bundle ; [he]172-philip breathed into it ; [he]172-philip opened [his]172-philip coat and pressed it against [him]172-philip . Then [he]172-philip listened , and heard nothing but the rain and the panting horses , and [Harriet]102-harriet , who was somewhere chuckling to [herself]102-harriet in the dark .

[Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott approached , and took it gently from [him]172-philip . The face was already chilly , but thanks to [Philip]172-philip it was no longer wet . Nor would it again be wetted by any tear .

Chapter 9

The details of [Harriet]102-harriet 's crime were never known . In [her]102-harriet illness [she]102-harriet spoke more of the inlaid box that [she]102-harriet lent to [Lilia]100-lilia - lent , not given - than of recent troubles . It was clear that [she]102-harriet had gone prepared for an interview with [Gino]144-gino , and finding [him]144-gino out , [she]102-harriet had yielded to a grotesque temptation . But how far this was the result of ill - temper , to what extent [she]102-harriet had been fortified by [her]102-harriet religion , when and how [she]102-harriet had met [the poor idiot]2526-the poor idiot - these questions were never answered , nor did they interest [Philip]172-philip greatly . [Detection]215-detection was certain : [they]1598-they would have been arrested by [the police of [Florence]24-florence]1599-the police of florence or [Milan]16-milan , or at the frontier . As it was , [they]1598-they had been stopped in a simpler manner a few miles out of [the town]461-the town .

As yet [he]172-philip could scarcely survey the thing . It was too great . Round [the Italian baby who had died in the mud there centred deep passions and high hopes]1601-the italian baby who had died in the mud there centred deep passions and high hopes . [People]1776-people had been wicked or wrong in the matter ; [no one]1773-no one save [himself]172-philip had been trivial . Now [the baby]2072-the baby had gone , but there remained this vast apparatus of pride and pity and love . For [the dead , who seemed to take away so much]1605-the dead , who seemed to take away so much , really take with [them]1605-the dead , who seemed to take away so much nothing that is [ours]1606-ours . The passion [they]1605-the dead , who seemed to take away so much have aroused lives after [them]1605-the dead , who seemed to take away so much , easy to transmute or to transfer , but well - nigh impossible to destroy . And [Philip]172-philip knew that [he]172-philip was still voyaging on [the same magnificent , perilous sea]1607-the same magnificent , perilous sea , with the sun or the clouds above [him]172-philip , and the tides below .

The course of the moment - that , at all events , was certain . [He]172-philip and [no one else]1608-no one else must take the news to [Gino]144-gino . It was easy to talk of [Harriet]102-harriet 's crime - easy also to blame the negligent [Perfetta]150-perfetta or [Mrs. Herriton]104-mrs. herriton at [home]334-home . [Every one]242-every one had contributed - even [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott and [Irma]103-irma . If [one]289-one chose , [one]289-one might consider the catastrophe composite or the work of fate . But [Philip]172-philip did not so choose . It was [his]172-philip own fault , due to acknowledged weakness in [his]172-philip own character . Therefore [he]172-philip , and [no one else]1608-no one else , must take the news of it to [Gino]144-gino .

Nothing prevented [him]172-philip . [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott was engaged with [Harriet]102-harriet , and [people]1776-people had sprung out of the darkness and were conducting [them]1776-people towards [some cottage]1615-some cottage . [Philip]172-philip had only to get into [the uninjured carriage]1616-the uninjured carriage and order [the driver]426-the driver to return . [He]172-philip was back at [Monteriano]7-monteriano after a two hours ' absence . [Perfetta]150-perfetta was in [the house]251-the house now , and greeted [him]172-philip cheerfully . Pain , physical and mental , had made [him]172-philip stupid . It was some time before [he]172-philip realized that [she]150-perfetta had never missed [the child]250-the child .

[Gino]144-gino was still out . [The woman]1620-the woman took [him]144-gino to [the reception - room]1291-the reception - room , just as [she]1620-the woman had taken [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott in the morning , and dusted a circle for [him]144-gino on one of the horsehair chairs . But it was dark now , so [she]1620-the woman left [the guest]1622-the guest a little lamp .

" [I]1620-the woman will be as quick as [I]1620-the woman can , "[1620-the woman] [she]1620-the woman told [him]144-gino . " But there are [many streets]2555-many streets in [Monteriano]7-monteriano ; [he]144-gino is sometimes difficult to find . [I]1620-the woman could not find [him]144-gino this morning . "[1620-the woman]

" Go first to [the Caffe Garibaldi]62-the caffe garibaldi , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip , remembering that this was the hour appointed by [[his]172-philip friends of yesterday]1623-his friends of yesterday .

[He]172-philip occupied the time [he]172-philip was left alone not in thinking - there was nothing to think about ; [he]172-philip simply had to tell a few facts - but in trying to make a sling for [his]172-philip broken arm . The trouble was in the elbow - joint , and as long as [he]172-philip kept this motionless [he]172-philip could go on as usual . But inflammation was beginning , and the slightest jar gave [him]172-philip agony . The sling was not fitted before [Gino]144-gino leapt up [the stairs]1091-the stairs , crying -

" So [you]144-gino are back ! How glad [I]144-gino am ! [We]2556-we are all waiting - "[144-gino]

[Philip]172-philip had seen too much to be nervous . In low , even tones [he]172-philip told what had happened ; and [the other , also perfectly calm]1625-the other , also perfectly calm , heard [him]172-philip to the end . In the silence [Perfetta]150-perfetta called up that [she]150-perfetta had forgotten [the baby]2072-the baby 's evening milk ; [she]150-perfetta must fetch it . When [she]150-perfetta had gone [Gino]144-gino took up the lamp without a word , and [they]1627-they went into [the other room]1325-the other room .

" [[My]172-philip sister]2515-my sister is ill , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip , " and [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott is guiltless . [I]172-philip should be glad if [you]144-gino did not have to trouble [them]1627-they . "[172-philip]

[Gino]144-gino had stooped down by the way , and was feeling the place where [[his]144-gino son]1368-his son had lain . Now and then [he]144-gino frowned a little and glanced at [Philip]172-philip .

" It is through [me]144-gino , "[144-gino] [he]144-gino continued . " It happened because [I]144-gino was cowardly and idle . [I]144-gino have come to know what [you]172-philip will do . "[144-gino]

[Gino]144-gino had left the rug , and began to pat the table from the end , as if [he]144-gino was blind . The action was so uncanny that [Philip]172-philip was driven to intervene .

" Gently , [man]625-man , gently ; [he]144-gino is not here . "[172-philip]

[He]172-philip went up and touched [him]144-gino on the shoulder .

[He]172-philip twitched away , and began to pass [his]172-philip hands over things more rapidly - over the table , the chairs , the entire floor , the walls as high as [he]172-philip could reach them . [Philip]172-philip had not presumed to comfort [him]144-gino . But now the tension was too great - [he]172-philip tried .

" Break down , [Gino]144-gino ; [you]144-gino must break down . Scream and curse and give in for a little ; [you]144-gino must break down . "[172-philip]

There was no reply , and no cessation of the sweeping hands .

" It is time to be unhappy . Break down or [you]144-gino will be ill like [[my]172-philip sister]2515-my sister . [You]144-gino will go - "[172-philip]

The tour of [the room]306-the room was over . [He]172-philip had touched everything in [it]306-the room except [Philip]172-philip . Now [he]172-philip approached [him]172-philip . [He]172-philip face was that of [a man who has lost [his]1631-a man who has lost his old reason for life and seeks a new one old reason for life and seeks a new one]1631-a man who has lost his old reason for life and seeks a new one .

" [Gino]144-gino ! "[172-philip]

[He]172-philip stopped for a moment ; then [he]172-philip came nearer . [Philip]172-philip stood [his]172-philip ground .

" [You]144-gino are to do what [you]144-gino like with [me]172-philip , [Gino]144-gino . [[Your]144-gino son]2560-your son is dead , [Gino]144-gino . [He]2560-your son died in [my]172-philip arms , remember . It does not excuse [me]172-philip ; but [he]2560-your son did die in [my]172-philip arms . "[172-philip]

The left hand came forward , slowly this time . [It]1632-it hovered before [Philip]172-philip like an insect . Then [it]1632-it descended and gripped [him]172-philip by [his]172-philip broken elbow .

[Philip]172-philip struck out with all the strength of [his]172-philip other arm . [Gino]144-gino fell to the blow without a cry or a word .

" [[You]172-philip brute]2561-you brute ! "[774-the englishman] exclaimed [the Englishman]774-the englishman . " Kill [me]774-the englishman if [you]172-philip like ! But just [you]172-philip leave [my]774-the englishman broken arm alone . "[774-the englishman]

Then [he]774-the englishman was seized with remorse , and knelt beside [[his]774-the englishman adversary]1634-his adversary and tried to revive [him]1634-his adversary . [He]774-the englishman managed to raise [him]1634-his adversary up , and propped [his]1634-his adversary body against [his]774-the englishman own . [He]774-the englishman passed [his]774-the englishman arm round [him]1634-his adversary . Again [he]774-the englishman was filled with pity and tenderness . [He]774-the englishman awaited [the revival]1635-the revival without fear , sure that [both of them]2379-both of them were safe at last .

[Gino]144-gino recovered suddenly . [His]144-gino lips moved . For one blessed moment it seemed that [he]144-gino was going to speak . But [he]144-gino scrambled up in silence , remembering everything , and [he]144-gino made not towards [Philip]172-philip , but towards the lamp .

" Do what [you]172-philip like ; but think first - "[144-gino]

The lamp was tossed across [the room]306-the room , out through [the loggia]607-the loggia . It broke against one of the trees below . [Philip]172-philip began to cry out in the dark .

[Gino]144-gino approached from behind and gave [him]172-philip a sharp pinch . [Philip]172-philip spun round with a yell . [He]172-philip had only been pinched on the back , but [he]172-philip knew what was in store for [him]172-philip . [He]774-the englishman struck out , exhorting [the devil]2126-the devil to fight [him]774-the englishman , to kill [him]774-the englishman , to do anything but this . Then [he]774-the englishman stumbled to the door . It was open . [He]774-the englishman lost [his]774-the englishman head , and , instead of turning down the stairs , [he]774-the englishman ran across [the landing]1087-the landing into [the room opposite]1312-the room opposite . There [he]774-the englishman lay down on the floor between the stove and the skirting - board .

[His]774-the englishman senses grew sharper . [He]774-the englishman could hear [Gino]144-gino coming in on tiptoe . [He]774-the englishman even knew what was passing in [his]774-the englishman mind , how now [he]774-the englishman was at fault , now [he]774-the englishman was hopeful , now [he]774-the englishman was wondering whether after all [the victim]1642-the victim had not escaped down [the stairs]1091-the stairs . There was a quick swoop above [him]774-the englishman , and then a low growl like a dog 's . [Gino]144-gino had broken [his]144-gino finger - nails against the stove .

Physical pain is almost too terrible to bear . [We]1644-our can just bear it when it comes by accident or for [our]1644-our good - as it generally does in modern life - except at school . But when it is caused by the malignity of [a man]1757-a man , full grown , fashioned like [ourselves]1644-our , all [our]1644-our control disappears . [Philip]172-philip 's one thought was to get away from [that room]553-that room at whatever sacrifice of nobility or pride .

[Gino]144-gino was now at the further end of [the room]306-the room , groping by the little tables . Suddenly the instinct came to [him]144-gino . [He]144-gino crawled quickly to where [Philip]172-philip lay and had [him]172-philip clean by the elbow .

The whole arm seemed red - hot , and the broken bone grated in the joint , sending out shoots of the essence of pain . [His]172-philip other arm was pinioned against the wall , and [Gino]144-gino had trampled in behind the stove and was kneeling on [his]144-gino legs . For the space of a minute [he]144-gino yelled and yelled with all the force of [his]144-gino lungs . Then this solace was denied [him]144-gino . The other hand , moist and strong , began to close round [his]144-gino throat .

At first [he]144-gino was glad , for here , [he]144-gino thought , was death at last . But it was only a new torture ; perhaps [Gino]144-gino inherited the skill of [[his]144-gino ancestors]1648-his ancestors - and [childlike ruffians who flung each other from [the towers]464-the towers]1649-childlike ruffians who flung each other from the towers . Just as the windpipe closed , the hand fell off , and [Philip]172-philip was revived by the motion of [his]172-philip arm . And just as [he]144-gino was about to faint and gain at last one moment of oblivion , the motion stopped , and [he]144-gino would struggle instead against the pressure on [his]144-gino throat .

Vivid pictures were dancing through the pain - [Lilia]100-lilia dying some months back in [this very house]1651-this very house , [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott bending over [the baby]2072-the baby , [[his]2072-the baby mother]307-his mother at [home]334-home , now reading evening prayers to [the servants]1916-the servants . [He]144-gino felt that [he]144-gino was growing weaker ; [his]144-gino brain wandered ; the agony did not seem so great . Not all [Gino]144-gino 's care could indefinitely postpone the end . [His]144-gino yells and gurgles became mechanical - functions of the tortured flesh rather than true notes of indignation and despair . [He]144-gino was conscious of a horrid tumbling . Then [his]144-gino arm was pulled a little too roughly , and everything was quiet at last .

" But [[your]107-miss abbott son]2560-your son is dead , [Gino]144-gino . [[Your]107-miss abbott son]2560-your son is dead , [dear Gino]2564-dear gino . [[Your]107-miss abbott son]2560-your son is dead . "[144-gino]

[The room]306-the room was full of light , and [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott had [Gino]144-gino by the shoulders , holding [him]144-gino down in a chair . [She]107-miss abbott was exhausted with the struggle , and [her]107-miss abbott arms were trembling .

" What is the good of another death ? What is the good of more pain ? "[107-miss abbott]

[He]144-gino too began to tremble . Then [he]144-gino turned and looked curiously at [Philip]172-philip , whose face , covered with dust and foam , was visible by the stove . [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott allowed [him]144-gino to get up , though [she]107-miss abbott still held [him]144-gino firmly . [He]144-gino gave a loud and curious cry - a cry of interrogation it might be called . Below there was the noise of [Perfetta]150-perfetta returning with [the baby]2072-the baby 's milk .

" Go to [him]172-philip , "[107-miss abbott] said [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , indicating [Philip]172-philip . " Pick [him]172-philip up . Treat [him]172-philip kindly . "[107-miss abbott]

[She]107-miss abbott released [him]144-gino , and [he]144-gino approached [Philip]172-philip slowly . [His]172-philip eyes were filling with trouble . [He]172-philip bent down , as if [he]172-philip would gently raise [him]172-philip up .

" Help ! help ! "[172-philip] moaned [Philip]172-philip . [His]172-philip body had suffered too much from [Gino]144-gino . [It]1658-it could not bear to be touched by [him]144-gino .

[Gino]144-gino seemed to understand . [He]172-philip stopped , crouched above [him]172-philip . [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott [herself]107-miss abbott came forward and lifted [[her]107-miss abbott friend]1092-her friend in [her]107-miss abbott arms .

" Oh , the foul devil ! "[172-philip] [he]172-philip murmured . " Kill [him]172-philip ! Kill [him]172-philip for [me]172-philip . "[172-philip]

[Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott laid [him]172-philip tenderly on the couch and wiped [his]172-philip face . Then [she]107-miss abbott said gravely to [[them]1660-them both]1661-them both , " This thing stops here . "[107-miss abbott]

" Latte ! latte ! "[150-perfetta] cried [Perfetta]150-perfetta , hilariously ascending the stairs .

" Remember , "[107-miss abbott] [she]107-miss abbott continued , " there is to be no revenge . [I]107-miss abbott will have no more intentional evil . [We]1660-them are not to fight with [each other]487-each other any more . "[107-miss abbott]

" [I]172-philip shall never forgive [him]172-philip , "[172-philip] sighed [Philip]172-philip .

" Latte ! latte freschissima ! bianca come neve ! "[150-perfetta] [Perfetta]150-perfetta came in with another lamp and a little jug .

[Gino]144-gino spoke for the first time . " Put the milk on the table , "[144-gino] [he]144-gino said . " It will not be wanted in [the other room]1325-the other room . "[144-gino] The peril was over at last . A great sob shook [the whole body]1662-the whole body , another followed , and then [he]172-philip gave a piercing cry of woe , and stumbled towards [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott like [a child]309-a child and clung to [her]107-miss abbott .

All through the day [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott had seemed to [Philip]172-philip like [a goddess]1664-a goddess , and more than ever did [she]107-miss abbott seem so now . [Many people]1665-many people look younger and more intimate during great emotion . But [some there are who look older , and remote]1666-some there are who look older , and remote , and [he]172-philip could not think that there was little difference in years , and none in composition , between [her]107-miss abbott and [the man whose head was laid upon [her]107-miss abbott breast]1667-the man whose head was laid upon her breast . [Her]107-miss abbott eyes were open , full of infinite pity and full of majesty , as if they discerned the boundaries of sorrow , and saw unimaginable tracts beyond . Such eyes [he]172-philip had seen in great pictures but never in [a mortal]1668-a mortal . [Her]107-miss abbott hands were folded round [the sufferer]1669-the sufferer , stroking [him]1669-the sufferer lightly , for even [a goddess]1664-a goddess can do no more than that . And it seemed fitting , too , that [she]107-miss abbott should bend [her]107-miss abbott head and touch [his]1669-the sufferer forehead with [her]107-miss abbott lips .

[Philip]172-philip looked away , as [he]172-philip sometimes looked away from the great pictures where visible forms suddenly become inadequate for the things [they]1671-they have shown to [us]1672-us . [He]172-philip was happy ; [he]172-philip was assured that there was greatness in [the world]1768-the world . There came to [him]172-philip an earnest desire to be good through the example of [this good woman]1674-this good woman . [He]172-philip would try henceforward to be worthy of the things [she]107-miss abbott had revealed . Quietly , without hysterical prayers or banging of drums , [he]172-philip underwent conversion . [He]172-philip was saved .

" That milk , "[107-miss abbott] said [she]107-miss abbott , " need not be wasted . Take it , [Signor Carella]131-signor carella , and persuade [Mr. Herriton]136-mr. herriton to drink . "[107-miss abbott]

[Gino]144-gino obeyed [her]107-miss abbott , and carried [the child]250-the child 's milk to [Philip]172-philip . And [Philip]172-philip obeyed also and drank .

" Is there any left ? "[107-miss abbott]

" A little , "[144-gino] answered [Gino]144-gino .

" Then finish it . "[107-miss abbott] For [she]107-miss abbott was determined to use such remnants as lie about [the world]1768-the world .

" Will [you]172-philip not have some ? "[107-miss abbott]

" [I]107-miss abbott do not care for milk ; finish it all . "[107-miss abbott]

[He]172-philip drank the milk , and then , either by accident or in some spasm of pain , broke the jug to pieces . [Perfetta]150-perfetta exclaimed in bewilderment . " It does not matter , "[172-philip] [he]172-philip told [her]107-miss abbott . " It does not matter . It will never be wanted any more . "[172-philip]

Chapter 10

" [He]172-philip will have to marry [her]250-the child , "[172-philip] said [Philip]172-philip . " [I]172-philip heard from [him]172-philip this morning , just as [we]2568-we left [Milan]16-milan . [He]172-philip finds [he]172-philip has gone too far to back out . It would be expensive . [I]172-philip do n't know how much [he]172-philip minds - not as much as [we]2568-we suppose , [I]172-philip think . At all events there 's not a word of blame in the letter . [I]172-philip do n't believe [he]172-philip even feels angry . [I]172-philip never was so completely forgiven . Ever since [you]172-philip stopped [him]172-philip killing [me]172-philip , it has been a vision of perfect friendship . [He]172-philip nursed [me]172-philip , [he]172-philip lied for [me]172-philip at the inquest , and at the funeral , though [he]172-philip was crying , [you]172-philip would have thought it was [[my]172-philip son]2417-my son who had died . Certainly [I]172-philip was [the only person [he]172-philip had to be kind to]2570-the only person he had to be kind to ; [he]172-philip was so distressed not to make [Harriet]102-harriet 's acquaintance , and that [he]172-philip scarcely saw anything of [you]172-philip . In [his]172-philip letter [he]172-philip says so again . "[172-philip]

" Thank [him]172-philip , please , when [you]172-philip write , "[107-miss abbott] said [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , " and give [him]172-philip [my]107-miss abbott kindest regards . "[107-miss abbott]

" Indeed [I]1677-he will . "[1677-he] [He]1677-he was surprised that [she]107-miss abbott could slide away from [the man]370-the man so easily . For [his]1677-he own part , [he]1677-he was bound by ties of almost alarming intimacy . [Gino]144-gino had the southern knack of friendship . In the intervals of business [he]144-gino would pull out [Philip]172-philip 's life , turn it inside out , remodel it , and advise [him]172-philip how to use it for the best . The sensation was pleasant , for [he]144-gino was [a kind as well as a skilful operator]1679-a kind as well as a skilful operator . But [Philip]172-philip came away feeling that [he]172-philip had not a secret corner left . In that very letter [Gino]144-gino had again implored [him]172-philip , as a refuge from domestic difficulties , " to marry [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , even if [her]107-miss abbott dowry is small . "[144-gino] And how [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott [herself]107-miss abbott , after such tragic intercourse , could resume the conventions and send calm messages of esteem , was more than [he]1677-he could understand .

" When will [you]172-philip see [him]172-philip again ? "[107-miss abbott] [she]107-miss abbott asked . [They]1680-we were standing together in [the corridor of [the train]237-the train]1681-the corridor of the train , slowly ascending out of [Italy]8-italy towards [the San Gothard tunnel]1683-the san gothard tunnel .

" [I]1680-we hope next spring . Perhaps [we]1680-we shall paint [Siena]31-siena red for a day or two with some of [the new wife]2571-the new wife 's money . It was one of the arguments for marrying [her]107-miss abbott . "[1680-we]

" [He]172-philip has no heart , "[107-miss abbott] [she]107-miss abbott said severely . " [He]172-philip does not really mind about [the child]250-the child at all . "[107-miss abbott]

" No ; [you]107-miss abbott 're wrong . [He]172-philip does . [He]172-philip is unhappy , like [the rest of [us]1680-we]2573-the rest of us . But [he]172-philip does n't try to keep up appearances as [we]1680-we do . [He]172-philip knows that the things that have made [him]172-philip happy once will probably make [him]172-philip happy again - "[1680-we]

" [He]172-philip said [he]172-philip would never be happy again . "[107-miss abbott]

[He]172-philip had reached love by the spiritual path : [her]1684-her thoughts and [her]1684-her goodness and [her]1684-her nobility had moved [him]172-philip first , and now [her]1684-her whole body and all its gestures had become transfigured by them . The beauties that are called obvious - the beauties of [her]1684-her hair and [her]1684-her voice and [her]1684-her limbs - [he]172-philip had noticed these last ; [Gino]144-gino , who never traversed any path at all , had commended them dispassionately to [[his]172-philip friend]695-his friend .

Why was [he]172-philip so puzzling ? [He]172-philip had known so much about [her]1684-her once - what [she]1684-her thought , how [she]1684-her felt , the reasons for [her]1684-her actions . And now [he]172-philip only knew that [he]172-philip loved [her]1684-her , and all the other knowledge seemed passing from [him]172-philip just as [he]172-philip needed it most . And now [he]172-philip saw what a very little way those things would go .

" [Miss Abbott]107-miss abbott , "[1697-i] [he]1697-i murmured , speaking quickly , as if [their]1701-their free intercourse might soon be ended , " what is the matter with [you]1697-i ? " Do n't talk of ' faults . ' [You]1717-i 're [[my]1717-i friend]2604-my friend for ever , [Mr. Herriton]136-mr. herriton , [I]1717-i think . Only do n't be charitable and shift or take the blame . As [he]172-philip spoke [she]1717-i seemed to be transfigured , and to have indeed no part with refinement or unrefinement any longer . Out of this wreck there was revealed to [him]172-philip something indestructible - something which [she]1717-i , who had given it , could never take away .

" [I]1717-i say again , do n't be charitable . If [he]172-philip had asked [me]1717-i , [I]1717-i might have given [myself]1717-i body and soul . [Philip]172-philip 's eyes were fixed on [the Campanile of Airolo]235-the campanile of airolo . But [he]172-philip saw instead the fair myth of [Endymion]218-endymion . [This woman]2409-this woman was [a goddess to the end]1724-a goddess to the end . For [her]2409-this woman no love could be degrading : [she]2409-this woman stood outside all degradation . This episode , which [she]2409-this woman thought so sordid , and which was so tragic for [him]172-philip , remained supremely beautiful . To such a height was [he]172-philip lifted , that without regret [he]172-philip could now have told [her]2409-this woman that [he]172-philip was [[her]2409-this woman worshipper]1725-her worshipper too . But what was the use of telling [her]2409-this woman ? For all the wonderful things had happened .

" Thank [you]2409-this woman , "[172-philip] was all that [he]172-philip permitted [himself]172-philip . " Thank [you]2409-this woman for everything . "[172-philip]

[She]2409-this woman looked at [him]172-philip with great friendliness , for [he]172-philip had made [her]2409-this woman life endurable . At that moment [the train]237-the train entered [the San Gothard tunnel]1683-the san gothard tunnel . [They]1728-they hurried back to [the carriage]244-the carriage to close the windows lest the smuts should get into [Harriet]217-harriet 's eyes .
